“Following the request by Comba residents to then chief minister Manohar Parrikar regarding the condition of sewerage system in Comba, he had taken speedy action and initiated the work. After Pauskar took charge, work gained momentum,” a press note signed by Raiturkar stated.

Title: Six child labourers rescued from restaurant, tea centre
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Surat: The district child labour task force including the labour department, anti-human trafficking cell and the city police on Wednesday rescued six child labourers employed in a tea centre and a restaurant from Katargam and Udhana area.

Official sources said the task force team had received information about the tea centre and the restaurant employing child labourers. A joint team of anti-human trafficking, labour department, NGO and the police raided Udhana and Katargam areas.

Sources said that the tea centre owned by Karamatullah Shaikh at Hodi Bungalow in Katargam and Srinath Purohit, owner of Chamunda Restaurant at Udhana, were raided and six labourers in the age group of 6 years to 12 years were rescued.

The rescued child labourers were made to work for 10 to 12 hours and that they were paid between Rs 6,000 and Rs 8,000 per month. Out of the six children rescued, three are from Rajasthan, two from West Bengal and one from Uttar Pradesh.

Assistant labour commissioner Ashish Gandhi told TOI: “We rescued six child labourers. The children have been handed over to VR Popawala Children Home for boys in Katargam.”

Title: Sensex falls 1,281 pts in 4 sessions
Content: Mumbai: Coronavirus jitters continued to be a drag on equity markets, bringing the sensex down by 392 points to 39,889 on Wednesday, and wiping out over Rs 5 lakh crore in the last four trading sessions. The sensex has now closed below 40,000 for the first time since the fall after the Union Budget earlier this month. In the last four sessions, the BSE bellwether has lost 1,281 points.Fears of a pandemic persisted as hundreds of new cases were reported globally on Wednesday, including the first US soldier to be infected in South Korea. The World Health Organization (WHO) has also called for urgent preparations to be made in anticipation of a rise in cases. Additionally, markets were subdued ahead of the release of the GDP numbers for the third quarter on Friday. According to BSE data, foreign institutional investors (FIIs) offloaded shares, with net sales of Rs 3,336 crore on Wednesday. Purchases by domestic mutual funds and insurance companies to the extent of Rs 2,785 crore helped offset the selling by FIIs.However, sentiment turned around in the US with the Dow Jones gaining well over 300 points, or 1.2%, in early trades. In India, the rupee also firmed up on Wednesday to close 23 paise higher at 71.66 against the US dollar on expectations that the trade deficit will narrow due to cheaper crude and fall in imports because of the virus.Among the sensex stocks, Sun Pharma, Maruti, L&T, Hero MotoCorp, Infosys, ONGC and RIL were among the losers. SBI, which is seen to be gaining on account of the listing of its credit card subsidiary, ended on a positive note and prevented a further slide in the index. Other gainers included Hindustan Unilever, which has announced the setting up a new subsidiary, along with HCL Tech, Asian Paints and UltraTech. “Recent global developments indicate that the coronavirus outbreak could escalate into a pandemic, which is taking a toll on markets across the globe, including ours. The Nifty has breached its critical support of 11,700 and settled below the same as well. We thus advise continuing with the ‘sell on rise’ approach in the index,” said Religare Broking VP (research) Ajit Mishra South Korea’s Kospi fell over 1% on Wednesday. Earlier, Japan’s benchmark Nikkei 225 closed nearly 1% lower, while Australia’s S&P/ASX 200 slid 2.3%. Hong Kong’s Hang Seng and Shanghai Composite also fell by nearly 1%. One of the positive developments for India was that crude prices also declined marginally.According to Indiabulls Ventures head (equity research) Manav Chopra, there is a high level of nervousness globally because of coronavirus. “Bears have hammered the markets hard and markets are now closer to the mentioned important zone of 11,600. Globally, too, markets are nervous and have fallen sharply. A breach below 11,600 will add to further pressure on the downside. However, if the markets were to hold on to the support zone of 11,600, a bounce-back is likely.”

Title: Bat for your hidden passions, cricket legend tells students
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Kapil Dev

SURAT: The man who led India to its first-ever World Cup win – Kapil Dev – had the audience in splits with anecdotes laced with wit as he delivered his first ever convocation speech on the campus of Veer Narmad South Gujarat University (VNSGU) on Wednesday.

The Indian all-rounder was the chief guest at the 51st annual convocation of the VNSGU which was organized at the convention hall of the university.

Such was the enthusiasm among the graduating students and their parents that the entire convention hall was jam packed. Many students kept standing in the hall to listen to Kapil.

The cricket icon was so moved by the enthusiasm of the students, who were waiting near the doorway and outside the hall, that he requested them to come closer to the dais.

In a lighter vein, Kapil stopped the anchor and started the convocation address. “Leave something for me to speak,” he said amid cheers from the students.

Wittingly sharing his life experiences, he informed the gathering that he had never got an opportunity to take up formal education in any college but he had got a chance to sit on the dais due to hard work and dedication.

“Education should be enjoyment, not compulsion. If you don’t enjoy whatever you do, it serves no purpose,” he said.

He urged the students to search their hidden passions. “My daughter had once asked me what I wanted her to become. I told her that it was more important for her to know what she wanted to become,” he said.

Talking about the importance of forgiveness, he recalled Nelson Mandela’s quote which the South African anti-apartheid revolutionary had delivered after he was released after 26 years of imprisonment.

“Mandela was my hero, and I had even got an opportunity to meet him. After he was released from jail he had said – ‘I forgive all those who kept me in jail’. So, forgive and move ahead,” he said.

He also advised students not to copy anyone but become original in whichever stream they pursued.

Ending his speech with a sentence in Gujarati, the raconteur said, “Mane Gujarati Avde Nahi” (I don’t know Gujarati). I could have communicated much better with you (students) if I knew Gujarati.”

Poet Rajesh Reddy, who was the guest of honour, recited ghazals during the convocation, which he said was at the request of the university’s top officials.

Title: Warburg Pincus pumps $150 million into Apollo Tyres
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

(Representative image)

CHENNAI: New York-based private equity firm Warburg Pincus will invest $150 million (Rs 1,080 crore) in Apollo Tyres , the tyre maker said on Wednesday. Apollo will be used to fund ongoing capital expenditure programme. The board of directors approved the issue of up to 10.8 crore compulsorily convertible preference shares (CCPS) of face value of Rs 100 each, for an aggregate amount of up to Rs 1,080 crore to the investor Emerald Sage Investment (owned by Warburg Pincus group), the company announced in its stock market filing.

The CCPS shall carry a dividend at the rate of 6.34% per annum. These can be converted into 6.3 crore equity shares within 18 months at a price of Rs 171 per share.

“The investment represents a primary capital infusion into the company and is subject to shareholder and regulatory approvals,” Apollo Tyres said. The company also announced an interim dividend at the rate of Rs 3 per equity share of face value of Re 1 for FY20. Apollo Tyres has been investing in capacity both in India and overseas. In the current fiscal, it has announced a capex of just under Rs 3,000 crore. Earlier, it had pumped in Rs 4,000 crore in its new plant in Hungary, which was commissioned in 2017. The company is also putting up a new plant in Andhra Pradesh and expanding capacity at its Chennai plant.

Apollo Tyres stock fell nearly 4% on the BSE and closed at Rs 149 on Wednesday.

Title: Mauritius President visits Nalanda ruins
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Biharsharif: President of Mauritius Prithvirajsing Roopun accompanied by his wife Sanyukta Roopun and other family members on Wednesday visited the ruins of Nalanda University on the first day of his two-day Bihar visit.

The visitors went around the ruins of the ancient university with senior officials and other companions and they were briefed about the remains of the main building, teaching, students, teachers, library and hostels of the varsity.

Surprising everyone, he replied in Hindi when asked about his experience there “Bahut accha lag raha hai.Yahan par pahli baar aaya hoon. Iske baare me suna hai, bahut bada hai ( I am feeling good here. I have come here for the first time but have heard a lot about it. The premise is very huge).”

Roopun added, “It was the place from where knowledge spread to many parts of the world. It is now included in the world heritage site list and it is our responsibility to protect this ancient site of learning more than ever before.”

The visiting President spent little over an our there before departing for Gaya. A tight security arrangement was made for the visiting President in Nalanda, who was received there by Nalanda SP Nilesh Kumar.

Title: Chaat vendor shot dead in Shivpur
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Varanasi: A chaat vendor was shot dead near Pisaur village under Shivpur police station area on Tuesday night.

According to police, Kamlesh Yadav (55) of Chandauli ran a shop of chaat and lassi near Pisaur bridge. He had gone to attend a marriage ceremony in Pisaur village on Tuesday night. Kamlesh’s son Sheru Yadav also went to the village and asked his father to go back. Later, while returning home, Sheru found his father lying in roadside bushes with serious injuries. He rushed Kamlesh to Deen Dayal Upadhyaya district hospital where doctors declared him dead. SP (city) Dinesh Kumar Singh said the deceased sustained gunshot injury. During preliminary probe, it came to light that he had an altercation with some locals.

Title: SGCCI building material expo from Feb 28
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Surat: The diamond city is set to witness its first-ever four-day exhibition on building materials at Sarsana from February 28.

The ambitious ‘Mega Build Expo-2020’, organised by Southern Gujarat Chamber of Commerce and Industry (SGCCI), aims to promote green building concept in the city’s real estate sector. To be held at the Surat International Convention and Exhibition Centre (SIECC), it will showcase unique building techniques and latest building material based on green concept for real estate industry.

According to the SGCCI office-bearers, the exhibition hopes to influencing visitors’ aesthetic sense with new designs and features for living spaces and also attract those intending to construct their dream home at cost-effective prices.

About 144 exhibitors from Surat, Ahmedabad, Vadodara, Morbi, Valsad, Silvassa, Haryana, Himmatnagar, Gurgaon, Mumbai among many other places will display their products — ranging from hardware, ceramics, home automation, furnishing, to insulation, paints, maintenance equipment, power tools, etc.

President of SGCCI, Ketan Desai said, “This is the first-ever exhibition dedicated to the real estate sector of the city. The exhibition will have modern and state-of-the-art products for the construction industry as well as the general public wanting to add new designs and products to their living spaces.”

Devesh Patel, chairman of the exhibition said, “We have given a special focus on green building products including solar and water harvesting. This event will give buying groups, retailers, interior designers, architects an opportunity to liaise and place orders, learn the latest industry developments and network with their peers.”

Title: Cargo facility adds spice to Surat’s shrimp business
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Surat: Surat and south Gujarat’s shrimp farming is set to get a major filip with dedicated cargo services.

It was a big day for the shrimp farmers on Wednesday when Spice Jet’s first freighter aircraft brought in about 24 tonnes of shrimp seeds from hatcheries in Chennai and Vishakhapatnam. This was the first-ever direct consignment of shrimp seeds to Surat in all these years.

Until now, shrimp farmers faced a lot of hassles in procuring the shrimp seeds due to lack of direct dedicated cargo flights to the diamond city. The seeds have to first airshipped to Mumbai and then by road to Surat. Farmers had to face heavy losses due to high mortality rate of shrimp seeds in the road journey.

Official sources at the domestic cargo terminal said that the Spice Jet freighter will be operating thrice a week connecting Chennai, Vishakhapatnam, Surat and Kolkata. About 24 tonnes of shrimp seeds were off-loaded at the terminal, about 8 tonnes of general cargo was sent to Chennai from Surat.

Shrimp business is booming in the diamond city and other districts including Valsad, Bharuch, Navsari. From just 300 metric tonnes per annum of shrimp production in 2009, the production has crossed to over 45,000 metrics tonnes per annum in 2019. The annual turnover of the shrimp farming in south Gujarat is pegged at Rs 2,000 crore.

There is an annual demand of 500 crore shrimp seeds in Surat and South Gujarat region. About 70% of the shrimp seed demand comes from Surat and nearby areas including Olpad, Sayan, Mandroi, Ichhapore, Dumas etc.

Head of the domestic cargo terminal operated by AAI Cargo Logistics and Allied Services Company Limited (AAICLAS) said, “Shrimp farming is a big business in Surat and surrounding areas. The freighter service will be a boon for these farmers. In fact, city’s cargo business will get a major boost with Spice Jet’s freighter service. We have all the required infrastructure to handle the cargo including cold storages, strong rooms etc.”

Pradip Navik, vice-president of Gujarat Aquaculture Association (GAA) said, “It is a big day for the shrimp farmers. Now, we won’t have to depend on Mumbai for getting the shrimp seeds. We expect the shrimp farming will get a major boost in the coming days as the travel time from Chennai and Vishakhapatnam has decreased drastically”

Photo quote:

“The entire shrimp farming community is excited with the direct cargo service from Chennai to Surat. This will boost the shrimp farming business in the coming days and we expect the production to increase by about 10-20% due to fast delivery of the seeds.

Manoj Sharma, president, Gujarat Aqua Feed Dealers Association

We always suffered heavy losses during transportation of shrimp seeds from Mumbai. It took almost 10 hours for the seeds to reach Navsari. Now, we will get the seeds within couple of hours after they will leave the hatcheries in Chennai and Vishakhapatnam.

Nehal Gandhi, shrimp farmer, Navsari

Title: Fire erupts at a jari unit, one rescued
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The reason behind the fire could not be ascertained

Surat: A major fire broke out at a jari manufacturing unit located near the Aman society at Bamroli on Wednesday morning. An 18-year-old boy was trapped on the first floor of the unit was rescued by the fire fighters. Babu Lal, was working in the unit when the fire erupted , received minor injuries in the fire. Since the exit of the structure was engulfed in fire, the boy could not come out of the building.

Sources in the fire and emergency services of the Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) stated that the fire broke out in the jari manufacturing unit located on the ground floor of the one-storey building near the Aman society in Bamroli at 8 am. The reason behind the fire is yet unknown but it gutted jari machines, fabrics and other raw material including jari laces kept in the factory.

Chief Fire officer, Basant Pareek said, “The exact reason behind the fire is yet to be known but it took us about two-and-a-half-hours to gain control on the blaze. Firemen rescued a boy who was trapped on the first floor. The fire spread rapidly on the ground floor due to the presence of combustible material including fabrics and laces. The worker sustained minor injuries and he was shifted to the SMIMER hospital for treatment.”

Title: Obstruction in flight path: Builders, residents get DGCA notices
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Surat: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) has served notices to the realtors of more than 70 buildings under 17 residential projects located in Vesu, with regard to the approach of the runway-22 on Vesu side of the Surat airport.

Official sources said that the DGCA has asked the building owners and presidents of the societies to remain present in the Deputy Director of DGCA office at Mumbai for the personal hearing under section 6 (demolition of obstructions caused by buildings and trees) of the Aircraft rules, 1994, on March 4.

Airport director, Aman Saini told TOI, “The airport authority had submitted the obstacle height details of the buildings to the DGCA. Before conducting the final hearing in the obstacles issue, the DGCA has asked the building owners and residents to remain present for personal hearing.”

Saini added, “The residents of few buildings had come to meet us in the office on Wednesday afternoon to represent their case. We told them that the matter is not in the hands of AAI as the final decision will be taken by the DGCA.”

The clearance of obstacles in the approach surface of runway-22 at Vesu side will pave the way for clearing the displacement of 615 metres imposed by DGCA. This means that the aircrafts landing from Vesu side will be able to use the full-length of the runway — 2,905 meters, instead of the current 2,290 meters.

Sources said that the survey of the buildings obstructing the flight path within 6.6km in the approach funnel of runway at Vesu had end in 2018. The buildings in all the 17 residential projects were found to have violated permissible top elevation and coordinates in the range of 12.36 metres to 0.56 metres in height.

Title: Hasura raised $9.9 million in series A
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Chennai: Developer tooling products startup Hasura on Wednesday announced that it has raised $9.9 million in series A funding led by Singapore-based Vertex Ventures US. The round also saw participation from SAP.iO fund — an the early-stage venture arm of SAP, existing investors Nexus Venture Partners and Strive VC. Several angels also participated in the round.

With this funding, Hasura will invest in engineering and product development, in addition to hiring across sales and marketing.

“While we double down on the Postgres ecosystem (an open source database management system), these funds will help us bring the Hasura and GraphQL (a language for APIs) experience to other databases to mobilise data in organizations by making high-performance and secure data access a reality,” said Tanmai Gopal, co-founder Hasura.

Speaking on the investment, Sandeep Bhadra, partner at Vertex Ventures US said, “We invested because of the incredible velocity of their product engineering, the community the founders built in such short order, and the pull from enterprises who want to empower their engineers.” TNN

Title: Freshworks acquires AI startup AnsweriQ
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Bengaluru: The country’s most valued software-as-a-service ( SaaS ) company Freshworks, has acquired Seattle-based artificial intelligence (AI) startup AnsweriQ for an undisclosed amount. The startup’s co-founder and CEO Pradeep Rathinam will join Freshworks as chief customer officer, becoming a part of the leadership as the Chennai- and San Mateo-based company eyes a listing in the US in the coming years.

AnsweriQ will complement Freshworks’ AI engine called Freddy helping clients leverage their data to automate and escalate queries from their consumers. The startup, founded in 2017, had raised $5 million in venture funding. The deal will expand the company’s footprint in the US to Seattle, after San Mateo in California and Denver in Colarado.

Freshworks, valued at at $3.5 billion, has closed about 10 acquisitions since 2015, mostly small deals of below $40-50 million through stock to acquire talent and technology capabilities. The SaaS company currently has 2,700 employees.

“The integration of AnsweriQ’s technology enhances our AI/ML capability in the customer engagement space and offers significant value to our customers,” said Girish Mathrubootham, Freshworks’ founder and CEO. Freshworks added in a statement that it has seen a 60% year-over-year growth in billings.

Title: Raksha uses WhatsApp for mediclaims
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Mumbai: Raksha TPA has launched an artificial intelligence-powered servicing for health insurance policyholders through WhatsApp . Customers, whose health policies are serviced by the third-party administrator, can register for the service either online or through a missed call.

Launching the ‘4U’ service, Pawan Bhalla , CEO, Raksha, said that by choosing from a menu of options, the policyholder can obtain an image of the health card, copy of authorisation letter, and a link to real-time claim registration. Policyholders can get list of authorised hospitals and also the directions to the health centres.

“We will soon be adding the option to engage with an executive instead of the chatbot,” said Bhalla. He said that it would be possible to incorporate an emergency button in future.

Raksha TPA is promoted by late Ritu Nanda and Dr Naresh Trehan famous Cardiovascular and Cardiothoracic surgeon is chairman and MD, Medanta hospital. It is one of the largest third-party administrators processing health policies with premiums of Rs 1900 crore.

Title: Lion injured in infighting dies
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Rajkot: A male lion aged nearly 10 years which was found injured on Tuesday night died during treatment on Wednesday. According to the forest department, the lion was found during regular patrolling in Bhaniya round of Tulsishyam- Khamhbha range in Gir east division on Tuesday night, a part of the sanctuary area. The lion was rescued successfully and sent to Jasadhar animal care centre, where , it succumbed to injuries during treatment.

“The lion had major injuries on its back due to infighting with another male. It died at the animal care centre from these inuries,” said a statement by the forest department. The post mortem was done in the presence of senior officials and veterinary doctor.

Title: Goa police get fleet of 44 new vehicles to tide over shortage
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The new fleet will replace the forces’ broken-down patrolling vehicles

PANAJI: Goa police ’s dwindling fleet of vehicles got a shot in the arm on Wednesday with the force inducting 44 brand new vehicles as part of an ongoing modernisation program.

The home department has sanctioned the purchase of 85 new vehicles, including motorcycles, for Goa Police.

Handing over the vehicles to Goa police, chief minister Pramod Sawant said that the government would continue to upgrade departments which provide direct service to citizens.

The new vehicles will replace old and dilapidated patrolling vehicles. Goa police’s existing fleet of jeeps and cars are either damaged beyond repair or have a tendency to breakdown very often. Officers of the force, due to the shortage of vehicles, had no option but to use their own private vehicles for official police work.

As part of its modernisation plans, a proposal has been moved by Goa police to the state government for approval, to purchase vehicles, which was long-pending with the home department.

Out of 85 vehicles sanctioned, the police will purchase 58 four-wheelers, while the rest would be motorcycles. It will purchase multi-utility vehicles (MUV), sports utility vehicles (SUV) and cars for the force.

Speaking about the seizure of drugs in the coastal belt and of an injured youth confessing on video of consuming drugs, Sawant said that he has already ordered an inquiry. “I have asked for inquiry in both the cases. Already one report has come in and we have also punished them,” said Sawant.

The chief minister also said that the government has decided to permit iron ore lease holders to export already extracted ore.

“We have already taken the decision that those who have been cleared by the Supreme Court will be given permission to sell the ore,” Sawant said.

Title: Eye on Satara land for new industrial corridor
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The final decision on the land in Satara district would be taken after the receipt of the technical and feasi... Read More

KOLHAPUR: The seven-year-old proposal for setting up an industrial corridor along the Mumbai-Bengaluru highway is set to be revived. Deputy chief minister Ajit Pawar had ordered a technical and feasibility report for land in Satara district.

Pawar conducted a high-level meeting in Mumbai on Tuesday and picked Satara district as it is near Sangli, Solapur and parts of Marathwada. The high-level meeting was attended by industries minister Subhash Desai, Satara district guardian minister Balasaheb Patil, additional chief secretary Nitin Karir and a team of officers from National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation, a union government undertaking.

An official communication released from Pawar’s office said the final decision on the land in Satara district would be taken after the receipt of the technical and feasibility report.

The meeting, held in Vidhan Bhavan in Mumbai and presided over by Pawar, decided to float a separate company for the purpose. Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) and National Industrial Corridor Development Corporation will have 51% and 49% stakes in the proposed company.

Union government has decided to develop two special zone along Mumbai-Bengaluru national highway. It will grant Rs 3,000 crore to the state government. Karnataka has already selected Dharwad district for special zone. Two states are expected to develop industrial zone at respective sites.

The proposal was moved February 2013 by the then chief minister Prithviraj Chavan. According to the proposal, Maharashtra government was intending to develop subsidiary corridors along the lines of Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor to attract the investors in industrial and agriculture sector. The proposal had then suggested that Satara, Sangli, Kolhapur, situated along national highway 4, be connected.

The proposed corridor covers Maharashtra and Karnataka and is expected to be spread over 1,000 km. In Karnataka, it covers districts of Davangere , Chitradurga, Hubali-Dharwad and Belgavi. In November 2013, UK government had shown interest in developing the corridor much like the Delhi-Mumbai Industrial Corridor, which is assisted by Japan.

Sources in the industries ministry said that the government was keen on an area near Phaltan or Karad in Satara district. Phaltan is already being developed for industries and has water through canal. Karad is close to Sangli and Solapur districts and is in position to have ample water supply because of Krishna river. Karad also has air strip, which can be developed, sources said.

Title: Sebi allows direct sales of mutual funds on exchanges
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

(Representative image)

MUMBAI: In a move that will increase access to direct schemes of mutual funds (MFs), Sebi has allowed investors to directly use the infrastructure of stock exchanges to purchase and redeem units directly from asset management companies (AMCs). Hitherto, investors who wanted to purchase direct schemes (without intermediary charges) had to go to the fund house or through a fintech platform like Paytm Money or Zerodha.

“While this move is in the direction of providing a level playing field to the exchanges, we will have to wait to see how this is implemented and plays out,” said Paytm Money MD & CEO Pravin Jadhav. “Dynamics of MF investing are changing fast with technology and, over the past months, we are already seeing investors switching even from AMC’s channels to us.” Paytm Money offers a platform for direct investment in MFs.

In 2013, Sebi had permitted MF distributors to use recognised stock exchanges’ infrastructure to purchase and redeem units directly from the fund or AMCs. Subsequently, in 2016, it allowed registered investment advisers to use the infrastructure of stock exchanges to purchase and redeem MFs directly.

Currently, fintech platforms — besides facilitating sales — also allow investors to compare performance of schemes and provide a host of information to users. It is not clear what kind of a platform the stock exchanges will build for direct MF distribution.

“The recognised stock exchanges, clearing corporations and depositories may make necessary amendments to their existing by-laws, rules and regulations wherever required,” Sebi said in a circular issued on Wednesday.

Title: Surat: College student ends life fearing failure in exam
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

SURAT: A 20-year-old BSc student hanged himself to death at his home in Dindoli on Tuesday night. Police said that the deceased Vivek Mishra ended life fearing poor performance during the ongoing exams.

Mishra, a resident of Patel Nagar in Dindoli, was a student of second semester at P P Savani University at Kosamba. On Tuesday evening, he went to his room. When his mother went to give him tea and snacks at around 11.30 pm, she found him hanging to the ceiling fan.

Family members called the paramedics who after checking declared him dead.

According to police, Mishra told his family members that he could not perform as per his expectation in two subjects. “He was good at studies but feared poor marks in two subjects,” said police, adding that his exams were still on.

Mishra's father is technician in a factory unit while his elder brother is working in the US.

Title: Gujarat: Over two lakh sugarcane harvesters set to go on strike
Content:
There are around 2 lakh workers, almost all of them being tribals, in sugarcane harvesting in around 15 sugarc... Read More

SURAT: The sugarcane harvesters in the districts of South Gujarat are set to go on strike from February 28 over various demands including hike in wages. The sugarcane harvesters, most of them being tribals, have given a call for an indefinite strike under the banner of Majoor Adhikar Manch, a state level trade union in Gujarat.“There are around 2 lakh workers, almost all of them being tribals, in sugarcane harvesting in around 15 sugarcane factories in South Gujarat. Majur Adhikar Manch has been organizing the sugarcane harvesting workers. It has undertaken mapping exercises and held meetings at both source and destination where workers harvest sugarcane,” said Sudhir Katiyar, an advisor to Majoor Adhikar Manch.According to Katiyar, sugarcane workers come from a vast hinterland spread over 12 districts of three states. The exploitation of sugarcane workers is going on and their working conditions have not improved. “We have sent a list of demands to sugar factory owners, state level federation and labour department,’’ he said.Trade union leader Jayesh Gamit said, “Sugarcane workers are demanding a hike in wages of Rs 400 per tonne which, according to union leaders, is Rs 250 at present. It takes almost 12 to 14 hours for two labourers to cut one tonne of sugarcane. It’s a job full of hardships.”Sugarcane has emerged as a major crop of the region because of cheap availability of water. The development of sugarcane farming and setting up of sugar factories to process the sugarcane have followed the Maharashtra cooperative model. Every year, almost two lakh tribal workers migrate from the districts of Dang and Tapi in Gujarat and Dhule and Nandurbar in Maharashtra. Dang accounts for almost 40% of the total workforce.According to an estimate, South Gujarat produces over 85 lakh tonnes of sugarcane per year.

Title: Flyover reduces traffic snarls in western Patna
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: In a huge relief for commuters, a newly constructed flyover near FCI godown in Digha has provided an alternate route to vehicles. The number of trucks parked on the two-lane road along the Digha-Danapur canal has also gone down sharply.

The flyover, which connects Nahar Road near Patipul Ghat with the approach road of Digha rail-cum-road bridge, provides direct connectivity to vehicles going from Phulwarisharif and AIIMS-Patna to the J P Setu.

Earlier, commuters on the 12.27km-long road underneath the Digha-AIIMS elevated road used to face frequent traffic snarls due to long queues of parked trucks. Similar problems were witnessed in other areas like Naubatpur and Phulwarisharif.

Traffic superintendent (SP) D Amarkesh told this newspaper that trucks were allowed to pass through the J P Setu only from 10pm to 5am.

“Trucks coming from AIIMS or Phulwarisharif take quite a few turns while going to the J P Setu. The flyover has, however, provided direct connectivity to those going to the setu due to which heavy vehicles take lesser time,” he said, adding that cops had also been deputed to ensure hassle-free vehicular movement.

Meanwhile, residents and commuters are happy with the commencement of vehicular movement on the Digha flyover.

Sanjay Kumar, who travels daily from Mustafapur to Sonepur, used to face regular snarls. “Going to office was hectic as I used to witness slow traffic movement throughout the stretch. However, with the opening of the Digha flyover for vehicular movement, I reach office early,” he said.

Phulwarisharif resident Abhilasha said, “It is such a huge relief to see no trucks parked on the Digha-Danapur Canal Road. Earlier, it would take me at least an hour or more to reach my college. The Digha flyover has not just eased traffic congestion, but also reduced travel time.”

Title: Motihari woman alleges gang-rape, FIR lodged
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

Title: RJD backs contractual schoolteachers’ demand
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Former Bihar chief minister Rabri Devi with her party and Congress Legislators

PATNA: RJD on Wednesday supported the demands of agitating contractual schoolteachers and sought the resignation of education minister.

Former CM and leader of opposition in Bihar Legislative Council, Rabri Devi, said the state government should accept the equal pay for equal work demand of the niyojit (contractual) teachers, who are on strike.

“The state government, instead of paying equal salaries to them, has been dismissing the teachers in an undemocratic manner. Their demands should be heard, so that the evaluation of answer sheets of Intermediate and matriculation exams would complete on time. The state government has been putting the future of thousands of students at stake,” Rabri told reporters on the Council premises.

Several opposition members protested and created ruckus in the Upper House over the niyojit teachers’ issue. As soon as acting chairman Haroon Rashid requested the members not to disrupt the House, chief whip Subodh Kumar of RJD and professor Sanjay Kumar Singh of CPI brought separate adjournment notices saying incompetent invigilators were deputed at several centres to examine the answer sheets of matriculation examinations. Many of them reached the well, pressing for a debate on the issue by ignoring the listed business.

The acting chairman, however, rejected the notice and took up the question hour during which most of the questions related to urban development and housing department (UDHD) were answered.

In response to MLC Krishna Kumar Singh’s question over slow progress in executing different projects under Bihar Smart City Limited, UDHD minister Suresh Kumar Sharma said Rs984.50 crore was allocated under the Smart City mission. Patna Smart City Limited (PSCL) has got Rs 380 crore while Rs 110 crore has been given to Biharsharif, Rs 312.50 crore to Muzaffarpur and Rs 382 crore to Bhagalpur, he said.

“Work is in progress on 16 projects under PSCL, including Integrated Command and Control Centre (ICCC), smart road, solar panels and Jan Sewa Kendra among others. Under Bhagalpur Smart City Limited, the construction work on ICCC is underway whereas bidding has been invited for development of ICCC software, smart poles and solid waste management plant. The projects which have been delayed due to some issues in bidding would be sorted out soon and work on those projects would begin in the next three months,” Sharma said.

He also assured that the encroachment near Buddh Murti at Kadamkuan would be removed in the next couple of months.

Title: CBSE Class X students have an ‘easy day’ with English
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Altogether 1.04 lakh CBSE students wrote the Class X English (language and literature) paper on Wednesday at 272 examination centres across the state.

Most candidates found the questions asked from the NCERT syllabus easy. “Language and writing sections were quite easy, but the literature section was very lengthy,” said Aman Kumar, a Class X student of St Karen’s Secondary School in Patna.

A Delhi Public School English teacher, Anju Choudhary, agreed that long questions may have been difficult for some students, while the writing and reading sections were simple.

“Students may find difficulties in long-type questions, carrying eight marks in literature section. One of the difficult questions was from Guy de Maupassant’s novel ‘The Necklace’, in which the students were asked to write about the characterisation of Madam Jeanne Forestier. There is not much content to write about. The other was from H G Wells’s ‘Invisible Man’,” Choudhary said.

Shivani Singh, a Class X student of St Michael’s High School, said the paper pattern was completely based on the sample papers issued by the Board. “All questions asked in the exam is from the NCERT book. Some questions were even repeated from the sample papers. Students who solved the sample papers found the English paper easy,” she said.

Suryakant Akela, English teacher at Loyola High School, agreed that the paper was easy. “Students who read all chapters sincerely will score well in English,” he said.

“I was quiet relaxed writing the paper. I’m confident that I would score better than expected,” said Prity, a student of Notre Dame Academy.

Karan Sinha, a student of Kendriya Vidyalaya Sangathan, too found the overall paper easy even though she admitted that she was nervous before the exam.

The CBSE regional officer (Bihar and Jharkhand) said the examination was held peacefully at all the centres without any untoward incidents. Apart from English, the Board also conducted the exam for Web Application and Media paper for Class XII students.

Title: Domestic passenger traffic registered 36.6% growth: Bihar Economic Survey
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The domestic passenger traffic registered an annual growth rate of 36.6% in the period 2014-15 and 2018-19

PATNA: The civil aviation sector in the state has seen a growth of 35.6% in the 2018-19 fiscal as compared to the 2011-12 figures, according to the 14th Bihar Economic Survey 2019-20 tabled in the assembly by the state government on Monday.

The gross state domestic product (GSDP) of the civil aviation sector has increased to Rs 252 crore in 2018-19 from Rs 31 crore in 2011-12, according to the survey. About 40.61 lakh passengers availed air services from Patna airport during 2018-19, compared to 31.1 lakh in 2017-18, a jump of more than 30%.

The domestic passenger traffic registered an annual growth rate of 36.6% in the period 2014-15 and 2018-19 and aircraft movement increased by 31% during the same period.

Patna airport registered a 12.9% growth in passenger traffic in the first three quarters (April to December) of the current financial year compared to the same period last financial year.

According to the latest figures issued by the Airports Authority of India (AAI), the city airport handled altogether 35,13,060 passengers between April and December in the current fiscal against 31,12,896 passengers it handled during the same period in the previous financial year.

Bhupesh CH Negi, Patna airport director told this newspaper on Tuesday that there has been an unprecedented growth in both passenger and aircraft growth at city airport, which would likely to continue in future. “The AAI is continuously upgrading the existing facilities and building new infrastructure to cater to this growth,” Negi said.

He added: “The AAI Patna has been increasing the number of passengers facilities at constraint terminal building, including x-ray machines for the registered baggage, frisking booths for women as well and check-in counters.”

Freight movement at Patna airport has also increased by more than six times, from 1.04 thousand tonnes in 2004-05 to 6.32 thousand tonnes in 2018-19. The freight business has crossed the previous year’s volume in the first six months (April- September) of fiscal year 2019-20.

To increase the freight movement from Patna airport, the AAI is building a cargo complex at the airport premises. “I am sure that the freight movement will record a huge surge once we get a cargo complex,” the airport director said.

‘Rs 1,219 crore for new aiport expansion’: Deputy CM Sushil Kumar Modi on Tuesday said the Centre has sanctioned Rs 1,216.9 crore for the new terminal building at Patna airport and allied facilities.

“Darbhanga and Bihta airbases will also be developed under the Centre’s ambitious Ude Desh ka Aam Nagrik (UDAN) scheme, which is aimed at improving the regional connectivity,” he said.

Darbhanga has been added under UDAN II scheme and the construction of temporary civil enclave has been completed.

Title: Kanhaiya Kumar, others to address rally on Thursday
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The rally is slated to begin at 10am

PATNA: CPI functionary and former JNU Students’ Union president Kanhaiya Kumar and several other noted social activists are to address the Samvidhan Bachao, Nagrikta Bachao Maha Rally at Patna’s Gandhi Maidan on Thursday. It is being organized by over 100 different groups under the aegis of NPR-NRC-CAA Virodhi Sangharsh Morcha to mark the conclusion of Jan Gan Man Yatra spearheaded by Kanhaiya.

The rally is slated to begin at 10am and likely to be attended by Mahatma Gandhi’s great grandson Tushar Gandhi, social activist Medha Patkar and Dalit leader Jignesh Mevani among others.

All India Congress Committee (AICC) secretary Shakeel Ahmad Khan, who is also one of the patrons of the morcha, said more than 3 lakh people were expected to participate in the rally.

“Tushar Gandhi, Medha Patkar, Jignesh Mevani and JNU Students’ Union leader Aishe Ghosh among several others have already reached Patna. We are expecting social activist Yogendra Yadav and actor Swara Bhaskar, but they have not confirmed yet,” Shakeel said.

When asked about the purpose of rally when the Bihar legislative assembly passed a resolution on Tuesday against the proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC) and allowing the National Population Register (NPR) exercise in state only in 2010 format, Shakeel said: “We are not satisfied with the resolution. First of all, it says nothing about the contentious Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). There should be complete clarity on CAA as well. Besides, we do not know whether the Centre will accept such a resolution or not. Thus, we are of the view that the resolution is a mere eyewash for vote bank politics and we will continue with our movement and the rally,” Shakeel said.

On being asked about the political parties participating in the rally, the Congress MLA said workers of Left parties, Congress, HAM (S) and most of the opposition secular parties are expected to take part.

Security of Kanhaiya also remains a cause of concern as his convoy during Jan Gan Man Yatra had been attacked at nine places in 38 districts. “We have taken permission from the administration for the rally and hope all necessary security arrangements will be made by the district administration,” Shakeel said.

Title: Guwahati flight makes emergency landing in Kolkata after false alarm
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Image used for representational purpose

KOLKATA: A SpiceJet flight from Mumbai to Guwahati made a priority landing in Kolkata around 9am on Wednesday after the pilot suspected fuel leakage in the aircraft. However, inspection later revealed it was a water leak that had triggered the false alarm.

The flight with 189 passengers and crew was flying around 100km north-west of Jamshedpur when the pilot contacted the air traffic control at Kolkata airport to report the suspected fuel leakage. The fuel caution light in the cockpit panel had suddenly started flashing, pointing to a possible problem in the fuel tank. The captain had loaded adequate fuel in the aircraft, but with still some distance to go for Guwahati, the captain did not take a chance. Kolkata being the closest airport, he decided to divert there and requested a priority landing.

The controller in Kolkata guided the plane in, clearing the way for the flight to arrive at the shortest possible time. The aircraft touched down at 8.58pm. However, engineers could not find any problem after inspection and declared it a false alarm.

“The pilots of SpiceJet B737 aircraft operated flight SG-6480 (Mumbai-Guwahati) and during cruise had observed the fuel caution light. As a precaution, they diverted to Kolkata. The aircraft landed safely and on inspection, it was found to be a false alarm. Instead, there was water seepage,” a SpiceJet spokesperson said.

The flight was cleared to depart at 12.42pm and took off for Guwahati with 183 passengers and six crew members.

Title: Delhi violence: Kolkata cops to videograph protests, step up vigil on social media
Content:
The cops stepped up their social media vigil and advised people not to share or forward unverified content.

Some motivated people may try to create trouble by posting inciting material on social media to create law & order… https://t.co/bOzRwRFrk3 — CP Kolkata Anuj (@CPKolkata) 1582649304000

KOLKATA: The Kolkata Police top brass has issued an order to videograph all protest rallies in the city in the backdrop of the Delhi violence. Commissioner Anuj Sharma took to Twitter to ask netizens to be cautious as some “motivated people might try to create trouble by posting inciting material”. He also asked his men to increase patrolling and be vigilant on the ground.The cops stepped up their social media vigil and advised people not to share or forward unverified content. Officers said legal action will be initiated against all those trying to incite problems. Other steps that the cops have been told to follow while covering protests include wearing helmets on law-and-order duty, arranging adequate transport in case protesters are rounded up, arranging alternative routes for normal transport and procuring a good number of guard rails.Speaking of sharing offensive content on social media, Sharma said, “Some motivated people may try to create trouble by posting inciting material on social media, which may create law-and-order issues. Be cautious in believing and forwarding such items. We are keeping a constant watch on social media activities and legal action will be initiated against people who may try to incite problems.”The advice came in the backdrop of the recent violence in Delhi that has already claimed 20 lives. The Delhi incident has led to a deluge of videos, photographs, memes and statements — some of which might incite trouble — attributed to various people being shared on social media without any validation. “Some fake videos are doing the rounds,” an officer said.Sharma, who also took to Twitter to stress this message, received immediate appreciation from Kolkata residents. Some even promised to help flag such false and misleading content on social media. In two cases, people reported such posts to Sharma’s Twitter handle. The CP responded to one and asked the Kolkata Police cyber cell to probe the case.Cyber law experts claimed “transmitting and publishing” any misleading content on social media is a punishable act even if the “source” of the information is someone else. “The cases dealing with spreading intolerance and promoting hatred amongst communities come under specific IPC Acts and not the Information Technology Act, 2003 that pertains to obscene material. One can be charged under IPC sections 295A, 153, 153A and 505, and can be punished with imprisonment for up to five years,” said special public prosecutor and cyber expert Bivas Chatterjee. Unlike the IT Act, experts said IPC has a larger ambit, including people who merely forward such posts.Other senior officers, including joint CP (crime) Murlidhar Sharma, joint CP (organization) Neeloo Sherpa, DCP (traffic) Rupesh Kumar and DCP (south-east) Ajoy Prasad, also advised similar caution.In December, Kolkata Police had taken to Twitter to advise netizens to think twice before “hitting the forward button”. Warning that some of these could spark rumours and help spread fake news, the police had appealed to the “good sense” of citizens.

Title: East-West Metro's Sec V-Phoolbagan connection likely in May
Content:
East-West Metro services are likely to be extended till Phoolbagan by May, said Metro Railway general manager... Read More

KOLKATA: East-West Metro services are likely to be extended till Phoolbagan by May, said Metro Railway general manager Manoj Joshi after a two-hour visit to the underground station on Wednesday morning.Even though the 16.5km East-West Metro — that will link Salt Lake’s Sector V with Howrah Maidan — is being built by Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation (KMRC), it will be operated by Metro Railway, which runs the north-south line. Metro Railway’s general manager, thus, applies for CRS inspection. On February 13, when the 5km elevated stretch was unveiled, railway minister Piyush Goyal had said the Phoolbagan station would be added soon.Metro Railway has already written to the Commissioner of Railway Safety (CRS) to inspect the underground stretch till Phoolbagan so that services can be extended soon afterwards. Even though the Sector V-Stadium corridor has been welcomed by commuters, meaningful rider count is expected only after trains start plying between Salt Lake’s Sector V and Phoolbagan.Joshi said, “The CRS has raised some questions which we are trying to address. Hopefully, the CRS inspect-ion will happen by the end of March.”On Wednesday, Joshi, accompanied by senior Metro Railway officials, arrived at the station around 10.20am. KMRC’s managing director Manas Sarkar showed him around. Joshi inspected every inch of the facility, especially the hi-tech sections, like the automatic station control room, the platform screen doors (PSDs) and the ventilation system. Joshi’s interest in the ventilation system was understandable since this will ensure that cool air circulating through the platform doesn’t escape into the tunnel like it does in the north-south stations.“The tunnel has some unique characters too. Since it will be cut off from the station by screen doors, ducts have been built to maintain ventilation inside the tunnel. The ducts will suck out hot air blowing out of the moving trains and direct it through the ventilation shafts on either side of the platform,” said an engineer.When Phoolbagan is added, Metro trains will ply underground in the city after 25 years. The last time a Metro rake made its debut underground — for a trial run — it was at the north-south line’s MG Road station, which started operating in September 1995. All new stations added to the north-south line since then have been above the ground, connecting tracks laid on viaducts.

Title: Rajkot: Drummer injured in ‘firing’ during marriage procession
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Drummer Dashrath Rathod

RAJKOT: A 25-year-old drummer got injured during marriage processon of folk artists Mayabhai Ahir’s daughter in Bhavnagar on Tuesday night. However, it is not clear if the injury was caused by celebratory gun firing or during fire cracker bursting.

Though no formal complaint has been registered, the police has received an application from the hospital and based on that investigation has begun.

According to the police, Dashrath Rathod, a resident of Juna Vadaj in Ahmedabad was hired as one of the drummers for the marriage procession that had come to Borda village of Talaja taluka from Amreli.

While people were dancing around the drummers some were bursting firecrackers nearby. After a loud sound Rathod fell on the ground. He had blood oozing out of his ears.

He was rushed to nearby hospital. R A Vadher, police sub-inspector of Datha police station said “We have received report that the drummer was injured due to firing from a gun between 9.30pm and 10.30pm on Tuesday night. We are investigating the matter.”

When contacted, Ahir told TOI, “I was busy in marriage arrangements. This incident took place when the marriage procession was 500 meters away from the venue. I did not hear any gunshot sound. I am told that our relatives did not fire any arms. The drummer might have got hit by a fire cracker.”

Ahir is a known folk artist in Saurashtra. He had also organised a ‘Lok Dayro’ on Monday night which was attended by many ministers of state government, including home minister Pradeepsinh Jadeja.

Title: Patna Airport News: Work on new Patna airport terminal gathers pace
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Construction of new domestic terminal building at Patna Airport on Wednesday

PATNA: The construction work for the new terminal building and other auxiliary units at the Jayaprakash Narayan International Airport is moving at a fast pace after being hit by delays in the take-off of the infrastructure projects.

Centre has allocated Rs 1,216 crore to the Airports Authority of India for the new terminal, which the Patna airport authorities hope to complete within two years. The two-storey structure is targeted to be ready by October 2022. The terminal will have the departure lounge on the first floor and arrival area on the ground floor.

“We need to keep the existing terminal building operational till the new one comes up,” said K S Vijayan, general manager (engineering), projects, AAI Patna . He added that relocating utility services and dismantling the existing structures to make way for the new terminal is a challenging task.

“To ensure that passengers don’t suffer, extension of the existing building is in progress which is spread over 1,850sqm on the eastern side of the terminal building, which is likely to be ready within one month,” Vijayan told this newspaper.

The extended area of the terminal will have security hold, check-in counters, X-ray baggage machines, male and female frisking booths, shopping outlets, retail segments and lounge facility.

Nearly 45% work on the cargo complex, technical block, fire station, air traffic control tower and multi-level car parking, has been completed. “These auxiliary buildings would be operational by March 2021. Two floor of G+5 multi-level car parking is complete, now the construction company is working on slab casting for the third floor,” Vijayan said.

Around 40% has been completed on the residential area of the airport, where six buildings are being constructed to accommodate 108 aviation employees.

Vijayan said, “One of the three hangars coming up on the land provided by the state government was nearing completion and it would be ready within a week. Total three hangars and offices of flying club and civil aviation, VIP room and guesthouse will also come up. For this we are demolishing the old structure.”

The construction work on IMD building would begin once the IMD headquarters in New Delhi finalises the layout of the new building.

Title: HC: Can Rs 12 cap for channels be put off?
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Swati Deshpande | TNN

Mumbai: The Bombay high court on Wednesday asked the counsels of the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India ( Trai ) to take instructions and get back to it on Thursday whether the new tariff cap of Rs 12 per pay channel in a bouquet can be deferred. The HC said it was necessary to ask this as it would take some time to hear the plea for an interim relief in the challenge to the validity of the new January 2020 tariff regime.

Television broadcasters, channels and producers have approached the HC to challenge the January 1 order by Trai that restricts the price of individual pay channels within a bouquet being offered to consumers. A bevy of senior counsels appeared on their behalf to seek interim relief. They suggested that at least till their plea is heard at length, the 2017 regime that allows for a price of Rs 19 per pay channel in the bouquet may be continued. Their argument was that this would protect the rights of broadcasters and even other stakeholders, including distributors.

In its order, the bench of Justices Amjad Sayed and Anuja Prabhudessai , said, “Considering the above and given the complex issues involved, it may not be easy task for us to hear all the counsels for the petitioners and the respondents and pass orders on the interim relief sought in the two days left with us before the impugned 2020 Regulations and 2020 Tariff Order is to come into force” from March 1.

Mukul Rohatgi, counsel for Star which is one of the petitioners, said, “Trai has no jurisdiction over content being provided by broadcasters.” Janak Dwarkadas, counsel for show producers, agreed with this and said that the regulator cannot act like it is “Alice in Wonderland” and must see that even the Kerala HC this month granted interim relief to several multi-system operators who challenged similar price restrictions imposed on them.

Dwarkadas said the Supreme Court in December 2018 had observed that there has to be a “balancing act” between rights of broadcasters as well as consumers. Other counsels Ravi Kadam, Navroz Seervai and Gopal Jain also submitted essentially that, till such time that the matter is heard for interim reliefs, no coercive action be taken. Jain is arguing for the broadcasters’ federation.

Trai counsels Venkatesh Dhond, Vineet Naik and Ashish Kamath said the broadcasters can publish a rate card within 15 days. But Kadam said, “This will be an offer by the broadcasters, which will lead to agreements. How do they go back (to recover money) if HC strikes down the new regulation eventually?” He and Dwarkadas said, “Challenge is admitted. The court had on January 30 already taken into consideration that the matter requires hearing.”

Rohatgi said it was a question of the rights of broadcasters too and that it is not the right of consumers to free entertainment. He said such price restriction will lead to “insignificant and minimal content” with cricket league coverage and shows of quality being hit. Dwarkadas gave an example of “Kyunki Saas...” but quickly added ‘Bigg Boss’ after peals of laughter at the mention of the old soap.

But Dhond said, “What is really pinching them is revenue.” He and Naik added that a plea being admitted doesn’t mean interim relief necessarily follows. Dhond said that the broadcasters were essentially trying to “ensure that the new regulation is still born”. He and Naik said that the new price was the result of an elaborate deliberation with all stakeholders and it was felt that broadcasters were abusing the freedom they had by making a la carte economically non-palatable to consumers so that they only choose bouquets.

For Trai, Dhond said, “Let me present our case. Detailed arguments are required for interim relief ... is what even the bench of Justices S C Dharmadhikari and Riyaz Chagla had said in an order earlier.” Dwarkadas said, “If the 2017 regulation, which caps pay channels at Rs 19, is kept on for a while, heavens are not going to fall. What is the great undue haste to bring in the new regime?”

Jain said, “Propriety demands that Trai holds Its hand for a while.” He added, “It is a balance of inconvenience. All stakeholders are dissatisfied. All challenged it.”

Title: Indian truck market will contract further: Daimler
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Chennai: India’s truck industry, which is reeling under an unprecedented slowdown due to slowing economic activity and proposed migration to BS6 powered vehicles from April 1, will contract by 10% to 25% in the current calendar year, a senior industry official said.

“Our forecast for the industry is that sales will fall to 2 lakh vehicles from 2.45 lakh in 2019. The best case scenario is 10% drop and worst could be 25%,” said Satyakam Arya, MD& CEO of Daimler India Commercial Vehicles (DICV).

The year 2019 was the worst year for the truck makers in nearly two decades. Sales of trucks dropped to 2,49,000 units from 3,78,000 units in 2018. “We saw the worst year for the industry from the best year,” he said.

In domestic sales, DICV’s sales dropped by 36% to 14,474 units YoY, in line with a 35% drop in industry volume. “The good news is that we remained profitable in a challenging year,” he added. Export volume rose to 8,000 units from 7,100 a year ago.

“We also sourced parts worth $125 million for the year from our Indian suppliers to our global operations,” Arya said.

On the bus side, Daimler Buses saw a 11% sales growth and 56% exports growth. “We expect the same levels of growth for this year also,” saod Daimler Buses India MD Thomas Fricke.

DICV has initiated work to get into freight aggregation space either picking up stakes in existing players or starting one on its own. The German company’s Indian arm will also explore foray into off highways engines and defence as part of de risking in a cyclical industry. “We are expecting some changes in the defence suppliers policy which today forbids a foreign company to participate and supply trucks to Indian arm forces,” Arya said.

Title: Three arrested for kidnapping of jewellery shop owner, Rs 12L ransom amount recovered
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Accused in the custody of Rajkot police

Rajkot: Three persons were arrested on Wednesday for allegedly kidnapping the owner of a jewellery showroom in Bhavnagar on January 29.

Police said the accused, identified as Rohit Kotar (30), Yashpalsinh Chudasma (28), his brother Shaktisinh Chudasma (27) and Kalpesh Kotar, had allegedly kidnapped Mukesh Jodhvani (43) from his residence in Prarabhda Residency at Bhangli Gate in Hill Drive locality of Bhavnagar. While police had arrested Rohit, Yashpalsinh and Saktisinh, Kalpesh is still at large.

“The accused had demanded ransom of Rs 50 lakh cash and jewellery worth Rs 50 lakh and only after receiving the ransom they released Jodhvani on January 31. The accused had kidnapped Jodhvani using a car after stopping his two-wheeler near his residence. The accused had threatened Jodhvani with firearms and knives while kidnapping him,” said N G Chaudhary, inspector with Neelambaug police station.

After paying the ransom and ensuring his release, Jodhvani was reluctant to lodge a formal police complaint out of fear. However later, when Vibhavari Dave, minister of state for women and child welfare, came to know about the crime, she convinced Jodhvani to lodge the complaint.

After the complaint was lodged, Bhavnagar deputy superintendent of police Manish Thakar formed four members team. “We initiated the investigation on the basis of CCTV footages of the crime spot, mobile network and using our informers. We traced the accused and nabbed them on Wednesday,” said Thakar.

The police recovered Rs 12.10 lakh cash, two cars and two cellphones from the accused. During the probe, the police found the involvement of one Kalpesh in the crime and launched a manhunt for him.

JODHVANI WAS BRUTALLY TORTURED

During his captivity, Jodhvani was brutally tortured allegedly by the accused. “The accused beat him up with bats and fractured his right hand. Then they laid him on a funeral pyre and threatened to set him ablaze, if he did not pay the ransom,” said Chaudhary.

‘JAI DWARKADHISH’ WAS THE CODE

The accused had instructed Jodhvani’s family members to hand over the ransom to the person who would utter ‘Jai Dwarkadhish’, a code language used by the accused to collect the ransom, police said.

Title: Sand-laden truck ploughs into closed shop, driver rescued
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The driver was riding the truck at high speed as the road was empty

Surat: A major accident was averted when a sand carting truck ploughed into a closed shop after jumping the road divider at Navjivan circle on the Udhana-Madgalla road during early hours of Wednesday. The driver, who was stuck inside the truck , was rescued by the fire fighters. He suffered serious body injuries.

Ram Gopal Pal (40), a driver of the carting truck was going towards Magdalla when he lost control of the vehicle and rammed into a automobile spare parts shop located on the main thoroughfare after jumping the road divider.

A team of fire fighters from fire and emergency department of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) who had rushed to the spot said that the driver was trapped inside the vehicle and was rescued within 30 minutes by cutting open the sheet of the front cabin of the vehicle.

Sources said that the heavy vehicles have been allowed to ply inside the city after midnight to 8 am in the morning when city traffic is less. The Navjivan circle, where the accident occurred, is one of the most busiest areas during the day time.

Krishna Modh, fire officer told TOI, “The driver was riding the truck at high speed as the road was empty. The front portion of the truck rammed into the shop and that driver’s legs got stuck below the steering.”

Modh added, “We had to cut open the front cabin portion of the truck as the doors of the vehicle were locked. It took more than 30 minutes for us to rescue the driver. The driver was taken out of the vehicle with some body injuries and immediately shifted to the New Civil Hospital.”

Title: Lord Krishna’s ‘tallest’ son and Kesavan’s successor Guruvayur Padmanabhan dies
Content:
Gajaratnam Guruvayur Padmanabhan

By: Sandeep ThomasTHRISSUR: Among hundreds of captive elephants in Kerala , there are no dearth of stars. So was the case with Gajaratnam Guruvayur Padmanabhan that died on Wednesday.Though not one of the tallest tuskers in the state, Padmanabhan stood above all of them, its status of being Guruvayurappan's favourite son making him the ‘tallest’.As the tusker that had been carrying the golden thidambu (replica of the presiding deity) of Guruvayurappan for years, devotees considered Padmanabhan as Lord Guruvayurappan himself. Wherever it went, people welcomed with garlands and even spread floral carpets for it.Padmanabhan reached Guruvayur temple at the age of 14 as an offering made by a devotee. After the legendary Guruvayur Kesavan’s death in 1976, Padmanabhan succeeded as the tusker to carry the ‘pon thidambu’ of Lord Krishna. In no time the elephant rose to fame and emerged as the most sought-after tusker in the festival circuit.Padmanabhan could also easily win over the crowds with its friendly demeanour. There has been no single occasion of Padmanabhan turning violent and harming any devotee: its mahouts, however, were often at the receiving end whenever it lost its temper.Writer and elephant enthusiast Madambu Kunjukkuttan said: “People regarded Padmanabhan as Lord Guruvayurappan himself. His Godly status earned him respect from all corners. After Guruvayur Kesavan, Padmanabhan emerged as the undisputed star.”Thiruvambady devaswom president Prof M Madhavankutty said Padmanabhan had graced Thrissur pooram for almost 40 years.“If Padmanabhan attended a festival, it was the unwritten rule or custom that he should carry the thidambu. No temple committees or elephant owners objected to this ‘rule’,” he said.Paramekkavu Devaswom president Satheesh Menon recalled Padmanabhan carrying the thidambu of Paramekkavu Devi in two Thrissur poorams. “His death is a big loss.”The elephant, captured from the Nilambur forests by an Alathur-based group, was offered to the temple by the owners of Ottappalam-based E P Brothers Group’s late EP Achuthan Nair and late E P Madhavan Nair on November 18, 1954.“There was a vazhipadu (vow to offer) to donate an elephant when my grandmother Lakshmikutty Amma fell sick, and the promise was fulfilled after her death,’’ recalled Rajkumar Nair, son of Madhavan Nair.“We used to visit him at the elephant yard of the temple and feed him. We could go close to it and hold its tusk. The mahouts used to bring it to our house at Ottappalam whenever it was passing through the area,’’ said Chithresh Nair, younger son of Madhavan Nair.R Narayanan and K P Karunakaran, retired deputy administrators of the Guruvayur Devaswom recalled Padmanabhan as docile. Devaswom chairman K B Mohandas and the Guruvayur MLA K V Abdul Khader have requested for a state funeral to the elephant.According to legends, Brahminy kites used to hover in the sky when it is paraded in the festival.In Video: Devotees pay tribute to Kerala's most loved tusker Gajaratnam Guruvayur Padmanabhan

Title: Delhi: ‘You allow people to get away with inciting violence’
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Supreme Court

NEW DELHI: The Supreme Court bench, which was hearing the plea for removal of the Shaheen Bagh protesters, refused to take cognisance of the violence in north-east Delhi, as pleaded by some petitioners, including former chief information commissioner Wajahat Habibullah and Bhim Army chief Chandrashekhar Azad . The bench said it would confine itself to the Shaheen Bagh protest and asked them to file a separate petition and approach the Delhi high court, which is hearing a plea on the issue.

Talking about the violence that had wracked northeast Delhi, the court said lives could have been saved and the situation controlled if police had taken timely action. It said the government should learn from how police in the UK and the US function without seeking a nod from other authorities.

Solicitor general Tushar Mehta, appearing for Delhi Police, however, said it was not right to blame police as they worked under very tough conditions. He said even when police take coercive action, they are still questioned in court. He said the ground reality was very different and a head constable was killed and a DCP lynched by a mob when they were discharging their duty.

The court, however, asked why the situation worsened to such an extent. “Why does it happen? If you start taking action against them then you will see the difference. It is very serious that 13 (the known toll then) people died,” the bench said.

Title: 2 months on, cops yet to nab anti-CAA protesters
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Varanasi: A number of FIRs were lodged against hundreds of people after the violent anti-CAA protests in Varanasi zone in December last year, but police managed to arrest only a few.

As police and district administration sounded an alert in Varanasi in view of violence in Delhi, TOI took stock of the progress in investigation of cases lodged in Varanasi, Mau, Azamgarh and Bhadohi between December 17, 2019 and February 5 this year.

After the protest on December 19 in Beniabagh, cops had arrested 59 people in Chetganj area.

Violent protests again broke out on December 20 in Bajardiha when a minor boy died in a stampede. Bhelupur cops arrested four persons from the spot and lodged FIR against 15 identified and 4,000 unidentified people.

SP (city) Dinesh Kumar Singh said four more persons were arrested later.

On January 23, Chowk police foiled a bid to launch a protest at Beniabagh and arrested six persons besides lodging FIR against 32 identified and 400 unidentified people. Two more accused were arrested in Beniabagh case, while 76 arrests were made so far, he said.

Azamgarh cops arrested 19 people on February 4-5 and booked hundreds of unidentified people in Jauhar Ali Bagh.

In Mau, FIR was lodged against 90 identified and 650 unidentified people after December 19 violence. “We arrested 40 people. We also served notices to realise over Rs 12 lakh for loss of public and private property,” SP Anurag Arya said.

In Bhadohi, 39 people were arrested by police for December 19 violence though FIR had been lodged against 227 people. ADG, Varanasi zone, Brij Bhushan said efforts were on to nab the remaining accused.

Title: Usgao-Ganjem to act against illegal migrants
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Ponda: The Usgao-Ganjem panchayat was forced to adopt a resolution against the alleged irregularities committed by migrants, after members of Swabhimani Usgaonkar, a local NGO brought it to the notice of the gram sabha recently.

The meeting saw heated arguments and police were summoned to control the crowd.

Members of Swabhimani Usgaonkar moved several resolutions that were passed unanimously by villagers, including taking action against illegal constructions by migrants, no permissions to be issued by panchayat to migrants, action to be initiated against migrants possessing Goan names and filing police complaints against such migrants. tnn

Title: Imports from Africa might hit cashew prices
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Farmers stand to lose in a big way with cashew procurement rates likely to plummet as low as Rs 6,000 per a bag of 88-kg this season.

Procurers said cashew imported from Africa are already in the market and would decrease demand for local cashew.

Traders and cashew processing unit owners have made it clear that the orchard growers in north coastal AP would suffer the most as cashew is chiefly grown in Srikakulam, Visakhapatnam and Vizianagaram districts.

Ch Raju, a farmer from Narsipatnam division, said: “Two years ago, cashew dominated Mango as the prime income provider in mixed orchards, the 88-kilo bag price (procurement rate from farmers) touched an all-time high of Rs 12,000, taking base procurement price of cashew with kernel to Rs 140.”

Sources in Palasa cashew market said there could be a major depression in local procurement prices, forcing the farmers to make desperate sales. Unfortunately, for most farmers, cashew has become the mainstay along with mango in mixed orchards and for them to make the switch to another crop could take at least five years.

The traders suggested that the government must impose heavy import duties on cashew from Africa, if the local farmers were to be protected.

Malla Sinivas, President of the Cashew Manufacturers Association, said: ”This is a death trap for local farmers. All these years, they have been used to very high procurement prices, making cashew one of the most viable orchard-cash crops for farmers. There was a time when agents would go from farm to farm procuring cashew (with kernel) during the season, while the farmers spent nothing on transportation costs, this scenario is going to change soon.”

Title: Ex Minister Babulal Verma faces public ire
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Kota: Former state minister Babulal Verma faced public ire on Wednesday when he reached the spot over Mej river to take a stock of the situation and to console the families.

Locals pelted stones at him and the windscreens of his vehicle was damaged. Police personnel reportedly kept watching it from a distance.

Locals alleged the ex-minister during his tenure under the previous Vasundhara Raje-government did no work in the area he was representing. He had to flee from the spot to save himself from public ire.

Speaking to reporters later, Verma said Bundi collector and SP were standing 20-25 meters away and the DSP was close to him but none of them stopped the angry group.

“I asked them to control the crowd, but they were silently witnessing the scene,” Verma said and added when he moved towards the hospital in Lakheri from the spot, a group of antisocials damaged his vehicle.

He claimed he would lodge an FIR against antisocial elements who attacked him and damaged his vehicle.

“We are at the ex-minister’s residence to lodge his complaint,” said Rajendra Kumar, sub-inspector and in-charge, Lakheri police station. He said the matter would be taken against antisocial elements after receipt of the complaint.

Title: ‘Violence government-sponsored to silence CAA protesters’
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Sarvari and Bilkis during the ‘occupy Raj Bhavan’ protest organised by Welfare Party in the state capital on W... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: As 75-year-old Sarvari raised her hand to shout ‘inquilab ayega’, the crowd assembled for the ‘occupy Raj Bhavan’ protest in the state capital responded in solidarity with Shaheen Bagh protesters.

Sarvari and 82-year-old Bilkis, popularly know as ‘Shaheen Bagh dadis’ (grandmothers) after they led the protest against CAA and NRC in Delhi, were in Thiruvananthapuram to participate in ‘occupy Raj Bhavan’ protest organised by Welfare Party on Wednesday.

Sarvari condemned the Modi government for unleashing attack on innocent people to suppress their protests and said these atrocities will only strengthen their voice. “We have a Constitution which speaks about equal rights. The country does not belong to him (Modi). How can a Prime Minister do this to his country. We the people elected him (Modi) as our PM. Claiming to bring peace, Modi, Amit Shah and their police are attacking innocent people,” said Sarvari.

“Modi speaks about ‘beti bachao, beti padhao’. When the girls are being assaulted in the country, how will they study and lead a life. We have completed 75 days of protest on road and will continue doing it. If we die, we will die in this land,” Sarvari added.Speaking about her Thiruvananthapuram visit from New Delhito participate in the protest here, Bilkis said the whole country was coming to Shaheen Bagh to support their protest and it is their responsibility to attend similar protests across the country.

“If we can travel at this age for the cause, youngsters can do more to save the Constitution and the country. The government and police are trying to sabotage our peaceful protests and promote the black law through riots. We do not want this kind of Prime Minister. Many people were killed in past few days, still nothing has been done by the government. We will continue the protest till the government decides to revoke their decision. We have faith in court’s decision regarding NRC and if we do not get a favourable verdict, the protest will continue,” said Bilkis.
