Title: Locals oppose property tax hike
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Secunderabad: The Secunderabad Cantonment Board’s triennial revision of the property tax for 2018-2021 has not gone down well among the residents as they claim the SCB does not even provide basic amenities to them.

On February 24, the SCB revised tax for domestic properties at between Rs 1.20 and Rs 1.80 per square feet and Rs 4 per square feet to Rs 12 per square feet for commercial properties.

Demanding immediate withdrawal of the revision, Telukunta Arunjyothi Satish Gupta, a social activist said, “If the SCB needs money for development, it should seek pending Rs 500 crore from the Centre and Rs 80 crore from the state government.” TNN

Title: BJP banks on youth to lead party
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Mangaluru: The ongoing organisational drive undertaken by the state unit of the BJP is banking on the youth . While presidents of all district units of the party are less than 50, new presidents of the respective assembly constituency units are less than 40. The party will rally around the leadership of these young leaders with seniors chipping in with their experience and counsel, says Nalin Kumar Kateel , state BJP chief.

This is an ideal way for the party to build second and third line of leadership going forward, says Nalin, who was himself ushered into the state party chief’s role by the central party leadership, despite the presence of many senior leaders.

The presidents of the district units will be supreme at their levels within the party forum and seniors, contemporaries and juniors alike, will take cue from their leadership, and carry out their bidding in the interest of the party, Nalin says.

However, in the public forum, party leadership will play second fiddle and elected representatives will be the the party’s face, Nalin adds. “There will be mutual respect between party leadership and elected representatives, and they will acknowledge others roles in respective areas of influence, and work collectively in the larger interest of the party. There is absolutely no scope for one-upmanship, as the party is larger than individuals,” he adds.

This is the mantra that the party under the guidance of national president Jagat Prakash Nadda has adopted, as the BJP strives to expand its cadre base. “We have 37 organisational districts, up from 36, that the party had until recently, and the party has elected presidents to 35 of these district units. Presidents of the remaining two districts will be elected shortly,” Nalin said, adding the entire process is carried out in a transparent, democratic fashion.

In choosing the young and energetic party cadre to hold positions of responsibility, the BJP is merely reminding them that these are not posts that one can merely flaunt on their visiting cards, but one they have to really shoulder over the next three years, Nalin said. The party office-bearers have the onerous responsibility of taking its ideology to every single booth across Karnataka, and will need a whole lot of teamwork and cooperation, Nalin asserts.

Title: Frenchman robbed, cops use CCTV footage to nab accused
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Varkala police, on Wednesday, arrested a 37-year-old man who robbed a French tourist .

Police identified the accused as Sujith from Paravur in Kollam. He was working as a staff at one of the restaurants on Varkala Cliff.

Police said that the crime took place early on Sunday. Arif Fatealy (28), who hails from France, is the complainant in the case.

The accused allegedly robbed a gold chain, weighing two sovereigns, from the complainant. The crime happened on the main beach at Varkala below the helipad where the complainant was spending time with his girlfriend. As it was dark and the beach was almost empty, the robber could snatch the chain and run away.

Police said Fatealy had arrived here in the first week of February and was staying at a resort, ‘The Lungi Vibe’ at Thiruvambadi beach. A few days later, the woman, who was with him at the time of the crime, arrived from the Netherlands. They both met here and grew closer.

After the crime happened, the complainant told the police that the robber was wearing a kurti with the word ‘Om’ printed on it in English. As part of the investigation, police collected surveillance camera footages for the past one week from all commercial establishments in the area and found the accused wearing that kurti in one of the visuals.

The complainant saw the video and identified the accused following which he was taken into custody. The police also recovered the gold chain, which the accused had sold at a jewelry shop in Attingal.

Police recorded his arrest on Wednesday and produced him before the local magistrate, who remanded him in judicial custody.

The accused was arrested by a team led by Varkala station house officer inspector G Gopakumar and SI MG Shyam.

Title: ‘More CCTVs to be installed in Doon Hosp’
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Dehradun: Authorities of Government Doon Medical College and Hospital (GDMCH) announced on Wednesday to install more CCTVs and central announcement systems in the hospital premises and purchase more walkie talkies. The announcement comes after doctors and other hospital officials were manhandled by the kin of a patient on Tuesday night.

GDMCH principal Dr Ashutosh Sayana told TOI that the nearest police station will immediately be informed if hospital staff senses any attempts at agitation by kin of patients.“We are planning to put grills outside labour rooms. Microphones will be given to nurses and the staff present in labour room and women’s hospital so that they can shout for help when needed,” said Dr Sayana while adding that CCTVs will be installed at every entrance in the women’s hospital.

Alleging medical negligence, the kin of a pregnant woman created ruckus at Doon Hospital on Tuesday evening. Reportedly, the kin slapped a female doctor and manhandled other staffers. Soon after, the hospital administration called the police.

Title: Goa: Congress makes stand clear, to fight zilla polls on party symbol
Content: Panaji: Making it official on Wednesday, Congress said that it will fight the March 22 zilla panchayat (ZP) elections on party lines in around 40 out of 50 constituencies.State Congress president Girish Chodankar made the formal announcement and said that the party had arrived at a consensus after deliberating over the decision and addressing the concerns of party MLAs.While categorically stating that the Congress would field candidates in Saligao and Siolim, constituencies controlled by Goa Forward Party , Chodankar said that it would support an anti-BJP face in the 10 constituencies where it does not have a strong presence.“We had called for a special meeting to discuss the ZP elections and the party’s preparations, and during the meeting there was a detailed discussion on some concerns from the Congress Legislature Party , but there was a unanimous decision that the ZP elections will be fought on the party symbol,” said Chodankar.While opposition leader Digambar Kamat was present for the meeting, some MLAs skipped the meeting. According to sources, the party MLAs had reservations over the party contesting the ZP elections on party lines in Navelim, Curtorim and Ponda. However, Chodankar said that despite the differences, the party was not divided over the issue.“There were some issues within the party since out of 50, 30 seats were reserved. The concerns have been addressed and that is why the executive committee, where the MLAs are also members, and we are all on one platform,” said Chodankar.He went on to say that the BJP along with the State Election Commission had colluded to see that “everything is rigged” to favour BJP.The state Congress president said that the “target is to defeat BJP” but ruled out an alliance with parties like Goa Forward Party.The ZP elections in Goa would be held on March 22 while next day, the votes would be counted. BJP has also announced that they would be contesting the election by fielding their candidates. The party is yet to announce in how many constituencies they will field the candidates.“We want to give vent to the unrest that is building up against the government,” said Chodankar.

Title: Hyderabad in driver’s seat for Toyota’s self-charging, hybrid electric luxury MPV
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Hyderabad: When it comes to luxury, especially automobiles, the city of Nizams has been streets ahead of some of its other metro counterparts. But now the city seems to be racing ahead even when it comes to sustainable luxury.

Japanese auto major Toyota Motor Corp, which marked its entry into the luxury segment in India with the rollout of its Vellfire self-charging hybrid electric multipurpose vehicle at an all-India price tag of Rs 79.5 lakh here on Wednesday, has bagged 20% of its total bookings for the newage MPV from Hyderabad.

Toyota has mopped up around 180 bookings for its latest offering over the past one to one and a half months, over 20% of which have come from two of its Hyderabad dealerships.

“Hyderabad has been a very good market for us. What was surprising for us is we got more than 20% of our Vellfire customers from our dealerships here. That is the main reason we were pulled to Hyderabad to have our all-India launch,” said Naveen Soni, senior vice president, Toyota Kirloskar Motor told newspersons here on the sidelines of the new offering rollout.

He said after Hyderabad, the highest number of its customers for the new offering are from Delhi, followed by cities like Chennai and Ahmedabad.

Soni pointed out that the first three months of shipment for the Vellfire, which comes with a 2.5 litre gasoline hybrid engine coupled with dual motors, has already been sold out thanks to early technology adopter customers.

“The kind of response we have been getting with the Vellfire, its giving us a good indication that the customers are looking at advanced technologies such as self-charging hybrid electric vehicles. Hence we are confident that in the future there will be more such products coming as CBU (completely built units) from Japan for Indian customers,” he explained.

Talking about the BS IV inventory, he said the company has very few of the old models left and hopes to clear its entire stock of BS IV vehicles by the end of the month.

“Right from September to October and November we tried to reduce the BSIV inventory by trying to produce less BSIV vehicles and introducing more BSVI vehicles. We have cleared most of our BSIV stocks and there are few vehicles left which we are confident of clearing by the end of the month,” Soni said.

Title: Greater Cochin Development Authority to present budget today, vows still on paper
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Greater Cochin Development Authority (Picture credit: Kerala police website)

KOCHI: Even while the Greater Cochin Development Authority (GCDA) is ready to present its budget for 2020-21 fiscal on Thursday, an analysis of GCDA activities in previous years shows that little has been done regarding the implementation of the projects proposed in the previous budget.

Major projects, including the Kochi Economic City and a tourism village in Palluruthy, which received prime focus in last budget, still remain on papers.

Other projects like an entertainment hub in Marine Drive and Mundamveli housing project for the rehabilitation of P&T Colony residents witnessed no major developments despite having received its focus in the budget.

GCDA chairman V Saleem refused to comment on the projects mentioned in the last budget and said all details about the status of the projects will be presented during the budget session.

The Kochi Economic City project aims at developing townships the suburbs—Aluva, Perumbavoor and Angamaly municipalities—which come under the limits of the development agencies. However, GCDA authorities had done little work so far though Rs 1 crore was allotted for conducting preliminary studies.

“There has not been any clear-cut idea on project’s benefits and how can it be implemented. Each township will consist of industrial units, healthcare institutions, educational institutions, tourism facilities, IT enterprises, sports facilities, service-oriented firms and residential areas etc. But no major development has been made,” said a senior GCDA official.

Setting up of a tourism village in Palluruthy is one of the fanciful projects designed by the GCDA and around 12.5 acres owned by GCDA in Palluruthy was announced to be used for the purpose. Rs 1 crore was allotted for the project but land allocation is yet to be completed. Shopping Complex at Manappattiparambu on PPP model, an open gym at Jawaharlal Nehru International Stadium are the other projects which remain as proposals.

Title: Arvind kejriwal: Outsiders to blame for Delhi riots
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal

NEW DELHI: Chief minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said “anti-social, political and external elements” indulged in violence in northeast Delhi, which left 27 dead and over 200 injured.

Speaking in Delhi assembly, Kejriwal said the aam aadmi didn’t want violence and Hindus and Muslims never wanted to fight. He said both Hindus and Muslims had suffered losses in the violence.

“The people of Delhi want to lead a life filled with peace, love and unity. All of this has not been done by the aam aadmi. This has been done by some anti-social, political and external elements,” the CM said, adding that people wanted to earn, provide a comfortable life to their families and create a bright future for their children.

Saying that the future of modern Delhi could not be built on a “pile of bodies”, Kejriwal emphasised, “It will be built on electricity, water and development. We should reject the politics of hate and riots. Delhi has to stand together and assert that politics which pitches brothers against each other will not be tolerated.”

After the assembly session, Kejriwal visited the riot-hit areas of Shiv Vihar and Karawal Nagar on Wednesday evening. He first visited the DCP (Northeast) office to take stock of the situation and then undertook confidence-building measures. He also announced compensation of Rs 1 crore to the family of head constable Ratan Lal who was killed in violence on Monday and also promised a government job to a family member.

Kejriwal said Lal was not killed while saving the life of a Hindu or a Muslim, but while saving his nation. The central government had also announced compensation of Rs 1 crore and a job to a member of Lal’s family.

Accepting that the situation was still very sensitive, Kejriwal said he had requested Union home minister Amit Shah on Wednesday morning to call the Army to control the situation.

Senior AAP functionaries said the CM had also written to Shah in this regard. “Through this House, I would like to appeal again to him that, if necessary, the Army should be called in to control the situation in the city. Curfew in the violence-affected areas should be imposed at the earliest to normalise the situation,” Kejriwal said.

The CM also urged people to “leave behind” the violence against each other. “All people should go back to their homes and try to live their lives peacefully and report all those elements who try to disturb their peace and unity,” he added.

Delhi was covered by media worldwide in the last three days for two reasons, the visit of the First Lady of the US, Melania Trump, to a Delhi government school to see the happiness curriculum and how the capital was burning when US President Donald Trump was in India, Kejriwal claimed.

“There was news of riots, hatred and divide in Delhi. Pictures of people’s houses, shops, entire markets in ruins were circulated by the international media. We have to decide on the pictures that we want to present to the world,” the CM said.

While appreciating Delhi Police for evacuating many families stuck in the violence and handling the situation despite “inadequate strength” and “lack of orders” from seniors, Kejriwal said there were some videos in which policemen were found helping the miscreants. “Many videos are going viral in which some policemen are seen helping the miscreants. If there are such people, they should be investigated,” Kejriwal said. He also appreciated the efforts of legislators and volunteers.

Title: Caught with lover, man paraded naked in Agra village; booked for rape
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Agra: A man, who was allegedly caught red-handed in a compromising position with a married woman by locals , was forced to strip and walk the streets of an Agra village, a purported video of which has gone viral on social media.

Sources said the man, who has two wives and three children, was in an extra-marital affair with another married woman from the same village.

They added that the woman’s brother-in-law caught both of them in an intimate position on Tuesday. Sources said, “The brother-in-law and other villagers rained kicks and punches on him. They tore his clothes and forced him to walk naked on the village streets. They also shot a four-minute video of him and circulated it on social media. It quickly went viral.”

Station house officer Pradeep Kumar said, “Based on a written complaint lodged by the woman’s relative, a case was registered against the accused under section 376 (rape) of IPC. He was later sent to jail.” “We have also come across the video in which he is being forced to walk naked. We are identifying the men involved and action will be taken against them soon.”

Title: High alert, strict vigil on social media posts
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Heavy police force was deployed in sensitive areas of the city to avoid any untoward incident

Kanpur: The city has been put on a high alert in the wake of violent clashes between pro and anti-CAA protesters in Delhi that has lives of several people, including a police personnel.

DIG Anant Deo said, “City has been put on a high alert after recent incidents of violence in Delhi. Section 144 has already been implemented while five police teams are constantly monitoring social media posts and messages including WhatsApp groups. Strict action will be taken against those found spreading rumours or posting offensive material on social networking sites.”

Besides, the police is also closely monitoring the sit-in dharna undergoing at Mohammad Ali Park in Chamanganj.

The police force have been deployed in sensitive areas like Chamanganj, Beconganj, Talaq Mahal, Nai Sadak, Pench Bagh, Babupurwa and Yateemkhana areas to maintain law and order, said the DIG.

A mock drill exercise for surprise check of people and their vehicles was also conducted in vulnerable pockets of the city on Wednesday.

A senior police official, meanwhile, said, “We are regularly conducting mock drill exercises to ensure that every necessary measure is taken for the safety of people.”

To recall, several people staged protest against CAA in Babupurwa and Yateemkhana areas which turned violent on December 20 and 21. Around, three people were killed while ten others were injured during the protest.

Title: ITAT ready to set up Doon bench
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Dehradun: Justice Pradeep P Bhatt, president, of the Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT), on Wednesday made a formal announcement of setting up of the Dehradun circuit bench of ITAT which would take up cases from February 28.

On Thursday, Union law minister Ravi Shankar Prasad would be in Dehradun to inaugurate the new ITAT bench. Bhatt said that the bench will have two members who would be handling all the cases of Uttarakhand that were being heard in Delhi bench. “All the staff and manpower required by the ITAT has already shifted to Dehradun, including all vaults of documents.”

He added that “the circuit bench is going to be a big relief for all the tax litigants who will no longer require going to Delhi for their cases.”

“Our Dehradun circuit bench is the second, while the first circuit bench is in Varanasi,” Justice Bhatt said, adding that over 89,000 I-T appellate cases are pending across the country and Uttarakhand has over 900 cases.

“We have set up the office in the premises of the Uttarakhand Cooperative Sugar Mills Federation, Jogiwala near railway crossing and on the first day, five cases are being listed for hearing,” said Bhatt.

Title: Cipla gets warning letter from USFDA
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Panaji: Indian drug manufacturer Cipla Ltd received a warning from the US health regulator, United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA), for not meeting manufacturing norms at its Goa manufacturing facility, the company said in a statement on Wednesday.

According to the company, the warning letter has been issued based on an inspection conducted in 2019.

Sources said the USFDA made 12 severe observations after the inspection, none of which were related to data integrity.

The regulator conducted a current good manufacturing practices (cGMP) inspection at Cipla’s Goa unit between16 and 27 September.

“Further to our earlier communication on the Goa manufacturing facility inspection conducted from September 16-27 by the United States Food and Drug Administration (USFDA), the company has received a warning letter from USFDA,” compliance officer and company secretary Rajendra Chopra said in a regulatory filing.

Cipla issued the statement to the stock markets as per the Obligations and Disclosure Requirements Regulations, 2015. The firm also said that it was in the process of addressing the concerns raised by the USFDA.

Cipla has manufacturing facilities at Kundaim and Verna, but the company did not mention whether the warning letter was specific to any particular plant in the state.

Title: Outer bund project gets Kerala government sanction
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

KOCHI: The state government has given administrative sanction for constructing an outer bund for Thanthonnithuruth , one of the islands off Marine Drive in the city. The Rs 6-crore project is expected to address waterlogging issues in the island.

As per estimate, the outer bund constructed around the residential area of the island can be also be used as a ring road. “Outer bund had been a long-standing demand by the islanders. Now, we have secured administrative sanction for the project. We have started efforts to secure technical sanction for it,” said T J Vinod, MLA.

According to the residents, they are living under constant threat of saline water intrusion. “Water would enter our houses during high tide. Earlier, this happened during November-December but it is quite frequent now. During the rain, which lashed the city on October 21, 2019, water gushed into more than 20 houses in the island,” said Ratnavalli, a nonagenarian resident. “Saline water would enter our premises most days. During rain, there would be knee-deep water inside our houses. Once the bund is constructed, we expect that it can bring a solution to the vexed issue,” she said.

Many of the houses in the island have been damaged due to intrusion of saline water. Some of the islanders have moved out while vast majority still live there as they have no place to go to. “During 2000-2005, land value in the area had touched Rs 15 lakh for a cent. Now, it has fallen to Rs 3 lakh or 4 lakh a cent, thanks to the stringent Coastal Regulation Zone (CRZ) rules. So, we are unable to even sell our land and move out,” said Dhanesh, a resident. As the raw materials are to be brought to the island using boats, the cost of constructing a house is very high. “Usha Raghunathan, who live alone in her dilapidated house, goes to her sister’s place in the night and returns in the morning,” said Preman P P, another resident.

Though the government had allotted funds for the work in 2014, the project failed to take off due to protests from a section of residents. “Funds were allotted for two projects — constructing outer bund and filling the residential area using red earth to raise its height,” said Subbayyan T R, a resident. “Irrigation department, which was to implement the projects, first started filling the residential area using red earth. But a section of the residents wanted that the work on the outer bund to be started first. The project was stalled due to the dispute,” he said.

Irrigation department officials were not available on phone to comment on the issue.

Title: Trump gone, garbage, cattle & encroachments return to Agra VVIP road
Content:
Heaps of garbage dot now the areas and have started raising a stink

AGRA: The authorities had made the City of Taj spick and span to welcome US President Donald Trump and his family, but within 48 hours of the high-profile visit, garbage , stray animals and encroachments on roadsides are back on the VVIP route from Kheria airbase to the Taj Mahal. The potted plants that were put to beautify the areas were missing at many places.The potted plants that were put to beautify the areas were missing at many places. TOI found stay cattle and dogs on the 'VVIP road' and even in the vicinity of the Taj Mahal. Heaps of garbage dot now the areas and have started raising a stink. On Wednesday afternoon, garbage was seen at Idgha bus stand crossing and on both the sides of the Mall Road and the Fatehabad road.Encroachments are back at Kheria crossing, Idgha crossing, Pratapura crossing, etc. Unchecked and haphazard parking on roadsides and even on footpaths on the 'VVIP route' has ensured the return of chaos on roads.Arjun Nagar resident Megha Verma said, “Citizens were happy to see the makeover of the city ahead of US President Trump’s visit. It seems the authorities are not interested in maintaining the positive changes made to the city. I fear that in the next few days the chaotic conditions will be back to square one. All the money spent will go down the drain and all the efforts will go in vain.”Newlywed Rohan Arora, who had come from Lucknow with his wife to see the Taj Mahal, said, “Seeing the Taj was a great experience. We had come to know about the makeover made by the authorities, but now, we can see garbage and stray animals all over. This is unfortunate. The authorities concerned must ensure a high standard of cleanliness and keep stray cattle off the roads.”Municipal commissioner Arun Prakash said, “The status of cleanliness on the VVIP route will be checked. Complaints have been received in this regard. We had removed all encroachments and did beautification work. Now, Agra residents have to play a major role in maintaining the standard of cleanliness. Encroachers will be identified and penalised. Our veterinary wing is working to tackle the stray cattle menace.”The civic body had made the 14-km VVIP stretch 'sparkling clean' and it was a treat to the eye. The preparations for the visit of the state guest on February 24 had started on February 15. Over 500 workers were deployed to clean and beautify the areas through which the VVIP route passes. All encroachments were removed and beautification work was done on a large scale. Hundreds of potted plants were placed on road dividers and roundabouts. Over 300 stray animals, including cattle and dogs, were caught and shifted to other locations. Cattle owners were warned of strict action, including registration of FIRs and fines, if their animals were found on the road.

Title: Cops bust illicit liquor factory, five arrested
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Kanpur: With the arrest of five persons, police busted an illicit liquor factory in operating in the Bidhnoo area of the district on Tuesday night.

Police also seized 46 cartons of illicit liquor, 22 drums of chemical, packing machines and empty liquor bottles from the spot. Police identified the arrested persons as Jahan Singh, Maan Singh, Brijpal Singh, Pradeep Verma and Mohit Singh, residents of separate areas of the district.

According to police sources, the liquor had to be supplied in rural pockets of the district. An FIR has been filed and investigation is on.

Apolice team from Bidhnoo police station raided the spot in Dahli Ujagar village in Bidhnoo on Tuesday night and nabbed five people involved in manufacturing illegal liquor, police source said .

Inspector Bidhnoo said, there were inputs about an illegal liquor factory in Dahli Ujagar villagesince long.

SP (rural) Pradyumna Singh said, "Forty-six cartons of liquor, raw material, packaging machines besides empty bottles were recovered from the spot. Labels of several prominent brands were also recovered." A case has been registered and all arrested accused were sent to jail, SP added.

Title: State govt to hold events on its 3rd anniversary in every district
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Dehradun: Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat held a meeting with senior government officials on Wednesday to review the ongoing preparations of the functions to be organised across the state to mark his government’s third anniversary. The incumbent state government is going to complete three years in office on March 18, 2020. Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat held a meeting with senior government officials on Wednesday to review the ongoing preparations of the functions to be organised across the state to mark his government’s third anniversary. The incumbent state government is going to complete three years in office on March 18.

During the meet, CM Rawat directed the district magistrates to take necessary steps, in consultation with local MLAs and minister in charge of the districts, to ensure participation of villagers in the events. He added that state residents must be made aware of the government welfare schemes and programs.

During the programme, which will be organised in each assembly constituency at the same time on March 18, development works carried out by the government in last three years will be discussed, according to officials

Title: Coronavirus: Flyers from Italy & Iran to be screened in Mumbai airport
Content:
Representative image

With coronavirus epidemic spreading, Mumbai airport on Wednesday said it will screen passengers arriving from Italy and Iran also. India has advised its citizens to “refrain from non-essential travel to Korea, Iran and Italy,” the government said in a statement on Wednesday .Meanwhile, Vistara said it will cancel 54 flights to Bangkok and Singapore next month.

Title: Kerala: Absence of bridge adds to the woes of islanders
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The islanders had been demanding that a bridge connecting their place and the mainland should be constructed a... Read More

KOCHI: Thanthonnithuruth is just a stone’s throw away from Queen’s Walkway on Marine Drive. But the island with a population of around 230 still remains cut off from the mainland.

The islanders had been demanding that a bridge connecting their place and the mainland should be constructed across the backwaters. “During 2010, there was a move by the then district collector APM Mohammed Hanish to construct a bridge. But some people came up with allegations that the bridge is constructed for helping the landsharks who are not residents of the island. Then, the collector shelved the project,” Subbayyan T R, a resident , said. “It is a fact that some businessmen own land in the island. We want at least a small bridge through which an ambulance can be plied. Now, we have to depend on country boats to shift patients to hospital. We use boats for taking bodies to the crematorium,” he said.

The islanders depend on the ferry operated by the state water transport department (SWTD). “The boat service to the mainland will start from the island at 6.20am and the last trip from the mainland to the island is at 9.30pm. The boat would conduct trips at an interval of two hours,” said Boban T K, a resident. Last year, Sugunan, a fisherman, met with an accident while he was repairing fishing net. “I fell off into the backwaters and my jaw got broken. The SWTD boat was not available as it was night. Friends and relatives took me to a hospital in the mainland. On the way, our boat got stuck in a rope tied to a fishing net and we had a narrow escape,” said Sugunan, who was a member of the team which won first prize in the Indira Gandhi Memorial Boat Race organized by the tourism department in 1986.

Title: Woman arrested for smuggling 20kg cannabis in Rajdhani Exp
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Agra: In a joint operation by GRP and RPF, a 27-year-old woman was arrested from Delhi-bound Rajdhani Express for smuggling contraband to Aligarh. Her accomplice waiting at Agra Cantt station was arrested as well.

Identified as Suman Singh of Salempur village of Aligarh district, the accused was booked under Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act. Police also arrested one Praveen Kumar, a Sasani resident of Hathras district. The 41-year-old was waiting in a hatchback at the railway station for Suman.

On Wednesday, circle officer of GRP Agra division Anurag Singh said, “Our police team seized 20 kg of cannabis, whose value is worth Rs 1.60 lakh. The contraband was smuggled from Visakhapatnam.”

“In the past few years, we have made several arrests of men and women who were acting as courier of drug cartels based in Delhi and Aligarh. Their modus operandi is simple. They book tickets of premium trains and travel like normal passengers to smuggle drugs. Till date, we haven’t found the source and the last man in the string of drug racket. None of the apprehended accused really knows, as who is the kingpin of the drug cartel,” he said.

Since 2015, nearly Rs 5 crore worth of cannabis has been seized from Agra Cantt railway station from scores of couriers said to be travelling from Visakhapatnam.

Title: Probe role of civic, police officials in woman’s death due to potholes: HC
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

NAGPUR: Expressing concern over a woman’s death due to pothole, the Nagpur bench of Bombay High Court on Wednesday directed the respondents to probe role of contractor and civic officials concerned into the accident.

The directives came from a division bench comprising justices Sunil Shukre and Madhav Jamdar while hearing a plea based on TOI report exposing dreadful condition of city roads that has led to several accidents and loss of lives till January 15. The bench also asked the registry to convert the suo motu writ petition (No. 838/2019) into a criminal PIL so that its scope could be expanded.

Amicus curiae Raheel Mirza submitted TOI report of February 12 to the bench regarding death of Indukala Chauhan (55) who sustained serious head injuries after her son’s bike abruptly slipped due to a pothole near Hazaripahad Square. The Gittikhadan cops filed accidental death and didn’t register any offence, in spite of HC’s directives.

In October last year, a division bench comprising justices Zaka Haq and Pushpa Ganediwala had directed the respondents — municipal commissioner and city police chief — to take action against civic and police officials concerned for any accidents due to potholes leading to loss of lives or injuries to citizens.

The amicus also submitted Visvesvaraya National Institute of Technology (VNIT) report on how small potholes have expanded into big craters in absence of repairs. The report was published by TOI on February 16 that exposed how ignorance of Nagpur Municipal Corporation (NMC) has led to manifold rise in expenditure towards repairs of potholes.

Earlier, former DCP (Traffic) Chinmay Pandit filed an affidavit stating that there are 10 traffic zones under the commissionerate of Nagpur city police. “As directed by HC, the main road coming under the respective traffic zones are inspected through in charge senior police inspector, where it was noticed that at 121 places either there are potholes or the roads are in bad condition.

He admitted that water gets accumulated at Narendra Nagar railway under bridge due to absence of proper drainage system, thus obstructing smooth flow of traffic.

Pandit informed that the e-mail id dcptrafficnagpur2gmail.com, WhatsApp number — 9011387100 and twitter handle @trafficngp are provided by the police department for lodging complaints in respect of potholes. “From October 16-18, 2019, a total of 282 complaints were received. From October 29 to November 12, 62 complaints were received,” he said.

Title: Eleven cities from Kerala now under NCAP scanner
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Aerial view of Kochi

Eleven cities from Kerala have been included in the national clean air programme (NCAP). They are Kochi , Thiruvananthapuram, Kozhikode, Kottayam, Palakkad, Alappuzha, Pathanamthitta, Kollam, Sultan Bathery, Kakkanchery and Thrissur.

Track the pollution level in your city

Of the total 25 monitoring stations from which data will be published, Kochi has the maximum number of monitoring stations (seven) followed by Thiruvananthapuram (four). Rest will have one or two stations. NCAP hopes that an action plan would be conceived to reduce particulate pollution by 20-30% by 2024 from the levels in 2017.

“Though central pollution control board announced NCAP, there is still ambiguity over how they would take the data into account. For example, though the rules clearly state that pollution should be monitored for 18 hours, in Kozhikode, the data was based on just 10 hours,” said Centre for Science and Environment’s executive director Anumita Roy Chowdhury.

She said the question remains whether we have an explicit official method to report long-term trend in air quality and report compliance against targets and a national ambient air quality standard. The programme aims to identify emission sources, assessment of contribution of these sources, prioritizing the sources that need to be tackled and thus maintain the air quality.

Title: BJP state prez announces new team of 34 members
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Dehradun: BJP state president Bansidhar Bhagat on Tuesday announced his new team of 34 members, including three MLAs, who have been given different organisational responsibilities.

The new team includes the three BJP legislators – Ritu Khanduri, Pushkar Singh Dhami and Khajan Das – who hold important roles. Khanduri is now the head of the women’s wing of the state BJP and Dhami is the vice president of Udham Singh Nagar. Rajpur Road legislator Khajan Das has been appointed as the state vice president.

The BJP has come out with a new list of party spokespersons which include Vinay Rohilla, Vinay Goel, Suresh Joshi, Navin Thakur, Prakash Rawat and Vinod Suyal. Devendra Bhasin, who was the BJP spokesperson, has now been appointed as the vice-president of Dehradun district. Puneet Mittal has been appointed as the treasurer of Dehradun district unit. The youth wing of the BJP will be headed by Kundan Latwal, SC wing by Ambadut Arya, ST wing by Rakesh Rana, OBC wing by Rakesh Giri and farmer wing by Anil Chauhan. On being asked about the Garhwal and Kumaon region imbalance, the state president said, “There is no such thing. The party has given important responsibilities to all the leaders. There is no question of leaving out any region while building the new team.” Bhagat has already announced the list of district presidents, sub-division heads and booth-level heads in all the fourteen districts

Title: Delhi Riots Latest News: Death lurks in hospitals as many of those admitted in critical state
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Family of Rahul outside GTB Hospital on Wednesday

NEW DELHI: On the fifth day of the mayhem in northeast Delhi, the death toll has risen to 32 on Thursday. One of those who had died was a mentally unstable man who was standing outside his house to help people. He collapsed after getting shot. By the time he was taken to a hospital, he had died.

The family of 22-year-old Mehtab had planned to get him treated at a bigger hospital in March. However, the plans ended shortly after his death. Yasmin, his sister-in-law, had a hard time holding back her tears as she waited for his body. She broke down after seeing another victim’s body being handed over to his family.

“What is this community divide that has been created and is taking the lives of innocent people? Mehtab’s best friend was a Hindu. Despite his mental instability, he was always very sensitive towards other people. He had stepped out of the house after hearing the gunshots just to ensure that everyone around was safe. Within five minutes, he was shot dead. A few people locked our house from the outside and we had a hard time getting Mehtab inside, but it was too late by then,” Yasmin said.

Like him, 32-year-old Alok Tiwari, a resident of Shiv Vihar, had ventured out to “protect his neighbourhood” from outsiders. However, he was caught in the crossfire.

A relative said they are yet to know the exact cause of his death. “It could have been a gunshot or stones. He was bleeding profusely from the head where he was hit. He was rushed to GTB Hospital, but he could not make it. The entire family is still in shock,” the relative added. Tiwari was married and had two children.

Another victim, Rahul Thakur (23), was shot dead when he stepped out to buy milk. “He feared we would run out of groceries and milk. He was shot in the chest and was found bleeding profusely,” said a relative.

At the emergency wards of hospitals, over 200 injured were ferried in the last 24 hours, several of them in a critical condition. Most had bullet wounds or were beaten with sticks. One of the critically injured was 22-year-old Shahrukh. He was beaten with rods and stripped naked. He was then paraded on the road. He is in the ICU at GTB Hospital and remains critical, said his father Yakub Ali.

At Jag Pravesh Hospital, Behrav, a resident of Brijpuri, was rushed in on Wednesday evening. He had been attacked by a mob in the interior lanes of the locality. Bleeding profusely, he is said to be serious by the doctors. His relatives said he had gone out to fetch grocery. He was cornered by a group, forced to remove his pants to prove his religion, thrashed and thrown into a drain.

Abdul Samad (21), who had gone to pray at the local masjid in Mustafabad, suffered a similar fate. Rioters barged inside and started beating people. Samad was hit by sticks and stones, which left him bleeding under his left eye. He was rushed to Al-Hind Hospital on Tuesday night and then taken to GTB Hospital on Wednesday morning. “I was provided basic treatment at Al-Hind. We waited the entire night as we could not leave the hospital,” said Samad.

Title: MLAs mull privilege motion against Nagarjuna varsity VC
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Guntur: Fresh trouble is brewing at Acharya Nagarjuna University ( ANU ) as YSRC legislators are planning to move a privilege motion against Dr P Rajasekhar, vice-chancellor, in-charge.

The legislators allege the VC is taking unilateral decisions. They said they have not been invited to the convocation to be held on Thursday. They were upset after finding an invitation card without the names of the district legislators. “The invitation doesn’t have my name as local legislator. It is a breach of protocol and I will raise the issue in assembly,” Ponnur MLA Kilari Rosaiah said.

He said he would had move a privilege motion as the VC is taking controversial decisions to humiliate public representatives.

Sources said Mangalagiri legislator Alla Ramakrishna Reddy, too, has expressed displeasure about the VC’s attitude in handling important decisions. Sources said several YSRC legislators are upset for the VC giving only one honorary doctorate during the convocation.

ANU has decided to confer honorary doctorate to ABK Prasad, veteran journalist and a critic of TDP president Chandrababu Naidu.

“ANU covers Guntur and Prakasam districts and we should have honoured eminent people from these districts and also from other parts of the country. We should utilize such occasion to recognize the services of prominent people and industrialists to seek their support for development,” said a legislator. He said a discussion with public representatives would have helped the VC take a better decision.

The in-charge VC Rajasekhar said they have a procedure to conduct the convocation and there was no rule to print legislators’ names on invitation cards. He, however, said the varsity has sent formal invitations to all the legislators in the district.

“As per the procedure, only names of the chancellor (governor), chief guest and higher education minister would be printed on the invite. We have not breached any rule,” Rajasekhar said.

He said they have followed instructions of previous governor ESL Narasimhan who directed the universities not to confer more than one honorary doctorate during convocations. “It is true that we could honour more people with doctorates. We will take a call on the issue after taking the present governor’s advice and implement from the next convocation,” said Rajasekhar.

Title: Now, get ‘digital darshan’ of Char Dham shrines
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Dehradun: Devotees from across the globe who are unable to visit Uttarakhand for the Char Dham Yatra will now be able to pay their obeisance at the four Himalayan shrines through an online medium.

According to government sources, Jio, a telecommunication company, has been tasked with facilitating a ‘digital darshan’ of the Char Dham shrines.

Every year, lakhs of pilgrims visit Uttarakhand for the Char Dham Yatra but many more skip the pilgrimage due to a variety of reasons. Such people would now be able to use the digital facility to offer prayers from any part of the world.

Sources said that the proposed platform would also provide ‘online darshan’ of other famous temples situated across Uttarakhand.

CM Rawat said, “Through digital darshan of Char Dham and other temples, people from across the world will learn more about spirituality in Uttarakhand. The online medium will be especially beneficial for those devotees who are not physically fit to undertake the Char Dham Yatra.” He added that record number of pilgrims went on Char Dham Yatra last year and the numbers are likely to go up further once the Rishikesh-Karnaprayag railway project and all-weather road project are completed.

During the 2018 Investors’ Summit, businessman Mukesh Ambani had met chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat in Mumbai and discussed plans to join hands to strengthen the internet connectivity in the hill state.

Title: Give detailed list of religious structures encroaching public land: HC to CS
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Nainital: The Uttarakhand high court on Wednesday directed the chief secretary of the state to provide a detailed list of religious structures encroaching public land in all the 13 districts and explain what steps have been taken against them.

Hearing a PIL on religious structures encroaching streets, public parks and other public land, a bench of Chief Justice Ramesh Ranganathan and Justice Ramesh Chandra Khulbe said that the chief secretary should furnish the details of such encroachments where no action has been taken. A lawyer said, “The court also said that if the officer fails to provide these details, he should be personally present in the court on March 4 when the case will be heard next.”

The directive comes just days after another division bench of Justice NS Dhanik and Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia, while hearing the same matter on February 10, had held that the chief secretary’s earlier reply was “evasive”. The bench had said that though the affidavit mentioned the number of such unauthorised constructions and action taken against some of them, it does not provide any information on what happened to the other structures.

The abundance of illegal religious structures across Uttarakhand has been a serious and persistent public issue. In fact, Uttarakhand was the only state to not file an affidavit in the Supreme Court despite its clear directions in January 2018 that directed the chief secretaries to frame policies in consultation with the government “in respect of existing unauthorised construction of a religious nature which had already taken place; and to review the same on a case to case basis”

Title: Fraud godman’s ashram demolished in Gotri
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

VMC demolished the ashram located in Dayanand Park Society

Vadodara: The demolition squads of Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) razed a large portion of self-styled godman Baglamukhi Prashant Upadhyay’s premises. The ashram also served as the residence of Upadhyay who was has been arrested in a cheating case.

VMC had received a series of complaints regarding the illegal construction by Upadhyay, but had not taken any action so far regarding the ashram located in the Dayanand Park Society near the Nilambar Crossroads.

It came to light that Upadhyay had constructed shades, enclosures and a porch at the ashram in the margin around his house and under the high-tension electricity line there.

VMC officials began the drive on Wednesday morning and the operation went on till the night. The teams had to use breakers mounted on earthmovers to raze a part of the building.

Officials said that they had to be careful while breaking the porch as it was an extension of a slab of the building.

The extent of illegal construction at the site is estimated to be around 1,250square meters. He razing drive had to be stopped for about an hour when Upadhyay was brought to the site by the city police for investigations.

Title: BJP protest land for another Haj House in city
Content: Jaipur: The Jaipur Development Authority (JDA) premises echoed with slogans by BJP members on Wednesday afternoon. Sanganer MLA Ashok Lahoty, along with BJP supporters, staged a protest at JDA for granting another land for Haj House in the city. Lahoty claimed that as per the rules, only one Haj House can be built in the state, then why have two places been allotted.“When there is already a land allotted to them in the city in Ramganj, then why another land has been provided. It is just to favour one particular community. At Ramganj, there is a presence of their community, then why land has been given to them in Sanganer? They do not have any members in the area. Already two times, curfew was imposed in Sanganer due to tussle, not any more,” said Lahoty.A court case decided the fate of the land recently. The party in support of the land said that apart from the Haj House, a land to build a rest house for the travellers in the city is also required. The protesters alleged that the government, pressured by one community, and for vote banks, did not go for appeal. “Government must appeal for the matter in a higher court. They did not present valid arguments in the case on proper grounds due to which the government lost. It should be reviewed again by the judiciary,” said Lahoty.Lahoty gave a memorandum to the JDA commissioner T. Ravikant as well. BJP members fear that the empty land will be utilised to create a protest ground in Jaipur similar to the one in Delhi against CAA and NRC. They shouted slogans stating that they will not let another ‘ Shaheen Bagh’ be created at Sanganer.In Video: Jaipur: BJP stages protest at JDA, opposes allocation of another land for Haj House
