The standing committee had called for a special meeting on Wednesday to further, discuss the draft budget. “We have continued all the works proposed by the municipal commissioner, but have reduced the financial provisions of the projects by 20%, which is to be used for the various development works suggested by the panel members during the meeting,” said standing committee chairman Uddhav Nimse.

He said that the committee did not discontinue any project but prioritised it as some of them will continue next year too. “This provision will be used for the various works suggested by the standing committee members,” said Nimse.

Moreover, the funds will bridge the missing links and also resurface the ring roads. This also includes the provision of Rs 10 crore for smart school projects, Rs 25 crore for developments of 20 villages, Rs 5 crore for renovation of Dadasaheb Phalke Smarak, Rs 5 crore for Green Gyms, Rs 5 crore for construction of toilets for women and Rs 2 crore each for all 31 wards for resurfacing of roads.

Earlier, several NMC standing committee members had accused the civic administration of making insignificant budgetary allocations for undertaking development works in their wards. They demanded the standing committee chairman Uddhav Nimse that adequate provisions should be made before the budget is finalised.

Nimse assured the panel members that justice would be done to all wards on this issue. Under the rule, the standing committee would finalise the draft budget and present it before the general body for its final approval.

Title: Refrain from sharing hate content: Aurangabad police
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: City police, taking a note of communal clashes and riots in Delhi, have appealed to the people to refrain from forwarding or sharing hate content or videos on the social media.

According to sources, the state police headquarters has asked the unit commanders to ensure there is visible police presence at all important places. Moreover, the reserve force has also been put on standby for responding to any untoward situation.

The appeal came after law enforcement agencies found that communally charged messages are rife on social media, and the messages are found to be aimed at flaring communal tensions. Police have also appealed to parents and guardians to keep a watch on their wards so that they do not, knowingly or unknowingly, forward hate messages and videos and end up facing criminal offences for the same.

Aurangabad commissioner of police Chiranjeev Prasad has issued an ultimatum of registering offences against anyone found spreading hatred from any medium.

“We are maintaining close vigil on notorious elements and anyone who pose a threat to city’s peace and communal harmony. We will take stringent action against them,” he said. The officer added that police will not hesitate from slapping cognizable offences against those committing mischief by trying to create communal tensions.

Title: Narrow escape for children as leopard enters school campus and kills dog
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Pilibhit: Children playing on the premises of a government school in Keeratpur village, around 2.5km from Barahi forest range of the Pilibhit Tiger Reserve, had a narrow escape after a leopard entered the campus from adjacent fields and attacked a dog on Wednesday morning. The leopard killed the dog and dragged the carcass to the fields from where it had emerged.

Terrified by the incident, children ran towards the classrooms and locked themselves inside. When headmistress Nidhi Diwakar arrived at the school, the children told her about the incident. Diwakar soon alerted the forest department.

A field forest team led by forest inspector Ajmer Yadav visited the spot and took photographs of pugmarks.

“It was an adult leopard,” PTR deputy director Naveen Khandelwal told TOI. “I have directed Barahi range officer DK Goel to deploy a picket of armed forest personnel at the school from Thursday morning for the safety of the students and to monitor the movement of the leopard.”

Khandelwal, however, hoped that the leopard would retreat to the forest in a day or two.

Meanwhile, the children continued with their classes with no security around. Concerned over the children’s safety, the headmistress, who also happens to be the only government teacher at the school with the strength of 37 students, said, “A shiksha mitra posted here has been entrusted with the invigilation duty for the ongoing UP Board Examination. Besides, as the primary schools are not provided with a Class IV staffer, it will be very difficult for me to ensure students’ safety. Today, the children were lucky as a dog came in between them and the leopard.”

Pradhan Ranjit Singh, meanwhile, appealed to the villagers to accompany their children to the school in groups.

Title: 2008 Malegaon blast accused fined Rs 10,000 for ‘delaying tactic’
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

File photo of 2008 Malegaon blast

MUMBAI: A day after the Bombay high court commented on the slow pace of the 2008 Malegaon blast trial, the special trial court on Wednesday fined an accused, Sudhakar Chaturvedi, Rs 10,000 for filing an unnecessary application.

The court dubbed the plea to seek the station diaries—from the beginning to the end of the case—as a delaying tactic. Special judge Vinod S Padalkar said Chaturvedi must pay the fine in the next three days.

The accused, a 47-year-old Mirzapur-based social worker, is accused of being in contact with the key accused and believed to have arranged several meetings among them. The blast at Malegaon killed six persons and injured over a 100 on September 29, 2008.

Special public prosecutor Avinash Rasal had objected to Chaturvedi’s plea.

Rasal submitted that a similar plea made by another accused in the case was rejected by an earlier judge in 2016. He also cited Section 172 (3) of the Criminal Procedure Code. The section states neither the accused will be entitled to call for such diaries nor can he be entitled to see them merely because they are referred to by the court.

The court also rejected another of Chaturvedi’s pleas in which he had sought details of his alleged transit from Bhopal to Mumbai before his arrest. The accused has claimed that he was tortured by the ATS when brought to the city. Rasal had opposed this plea too and iterated that the details were not part of the chargsheet of either the ATS, the first agency to investigate the blast, or the NIA which took over the investigation later.

The court, though, allowed another plea by Chaturvedi seeking his narco-analysis and brain-mapping report. Rasal has submitted that the reports were not part of the chargesheet.

Rasal said the court also asked the defence lawyers to take note of the fact that no one was observing its order directing the accused to be present at least once a week. Among the other accused on trial are BJP’s Bhopal MP Pragya Thakur and Lt Col Prasad Purohit. Both are out on bail. So far, 140 witnesses have deposed.

Title: Nashik: Rural police help man get back Rs 91,000 lost to online scam
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The cyber police station ( Nashik rural) on Wednesday helped a man get back around Rs 91,000 of the Rs 1 lakh that he was duped of online.

The complainant, Kashinath Chavan, thanked the rural police for acting swiftly and helping him get his money back. According to police, Chavan, who works in an oil company in Manmad, got a call from the conman on Saturday.

“The caller introduced himself as the representative of an online payment wallet company and informed Chavan that he had won a prize. The conman then asked Chavan to click on a web link that was sent on the latter’s cellphone following which the prize money would be transferred,” a police officer said.

“Not finding anything fishy, Chavan clicked on the link. Minutes later he got a message that Rs 1 lakh had been deducted from his bank account. Chavan immediately realised that he was cheated and approached cyber police station to register a complaint,” he added.

Cyber police team led by police inspector Subhash Anmulwar took all technical information of the complainant’s account and sent notices to the nodal officers of a few online pay wallet companies.

Later, the nodal officers concerned were also informed that a person was cheated of Rs 1 lakh; hence, transaction of moving the money from one account to another should be immediately stopped. Eventually, police managed to get Rs 91,173 back in Chavan’s back account.

“People should not trust unidentified people calling to seek personal details. No bank that asks personal details over the phone. If people have any doubt regarding their bank accounts, they should visit the bank personally. At the same time, people should not click any link received on their cellphone which they are unaware of,” Anmulwar said,

“Still, if anyone gets cheated, they should immediately contact the nearest police station or cyber police station,” he added.

Title: HC: Does Telangana have will to raze 2,400 illegal religious structures in Hyderabad?
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: The Telangana high court on Wednesday came down heavily on the state administration over 2,400 illegal religious structures at public places and asked the government if it has the wherewithal to take action.

Assailing authorities for turning a blind eye towards mushrooming of such structures, a bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy said the number must have gone up in last 10 years. “By 2010, number of illegal structures was 6,707, and 2,402 of them were illegally built religious structures. Let us start cleaning up the mess from the twin cities,” the bench said.

“Neither Constitution nor courts will offer any protection to such patently illegal structures,” the CJ said. Talking tough, HC sought to know from chief secretary Somesh Kumar whether government has any policy to deal with the issue without buckling under pressure from any quarter.

Referring to GO 262 (March 31, 2010) which had laid down guidelines to deal with illegal buildings, including unauthorised religious structures of different faiths, the bench sought to know from principal secretary, municipal administration, Arvind Kumar what the state intends to do.

Arvind Kumar explained that as per guidelines they have the mandate to bring down illegal religious structures raised recently. “In respect of slightly older structures, the guidelines say that they can be pulled down after taking the locals into confidence. There is a third category of very old religious structures. We propose to demolish them only after holding detailed discussions with stakeholders,” Arvind said.

Questioning the government on what it would do if the deliberations were to fail, the CJ asked: “Will the government shy away from implementing the law? Why don’t you (government) spell out your policy in a clear manner and send a strong message to society that illegal structures will not be tolerated even under the garb of religious freedom.”

The bench earlier rapped the state for its casual manner in which an incomplete affidavit was filed by the chief secretary (CS) regarding an illegal temple in Rock Garden layout at Madhavapuri Hills, Ameenpur. The bench, while hearing a PIL filed by Human Rights and Consumer Protection Cell Trust, had sought the affidavit from the CS. “We are rejecting this affidavit as it is vague and incomplete,” the CJ said, chastising the cops and revenue officials for not showing the will power to deal with the situation firmly.

Government pleader for revenue department CV Bhaskar Reddy withdrew the affidavit and promised to get a detailed affidavit soon. In line with an earlier directive, Arvind along with panchayat raj secretary Sandeep Kumar Sultania and Sangareddy collector M Hanumantha Rao were also present before the court.

The bench also found fault with the Ameenpur temple committee for failing to file its counter and rejected an attempt by advocate Umesh Chandra to implead devotees in the matter. It appointed advocate N Praveen Reddy as advocate commission to study the Ameenpur temple issue.

It sought a report by March 13. Hearing would resume in the matter on March 16.

Title: Rajasthan: Government officials to go on strike
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: Over 2 lakh employees including block development officers (BDOs), patwaris, gram sevaks, animal husbandry department officials in all the districts of Rajasthan will be on strike on Thursday.

They will be holding demonstrations outside district collectorates against delay in payment of salaries, salary cut and delay in filling vacant posts in various departments, bringing back the old pension scheme, to make contractual employees permanent and downsizing of government departments.

"In 2013, Gehlot government had revised the pay scale of the employees. The last BJP government withdrew this move of the previous government and reduced the pay scale," said Tej Singh Rathore , general secretary, All Rajasthan State Government Employees’ Federation.

Title: Goa: ‘It’s a great relief to finally be returning to our families’
Content:
138 Indians onboard Diamond Princess have been flown back to India

MARGAO: After weeks of battling anxiety on the luxury cruise liner, Diamond Princess, which was quarantined off the coast of Japan since February 3 due to cases of coronavirus on board, Dhanesh Raikar from Chinchinim finally got airborne to return to his motherland.Raikar, along with at least 50 other Goans , is among the 138 Indians on Diamond Princess who have been flown back to India by an Air India aircraft chartered by the Indian government.The aircraft was expected to land at New Delhi airport late on Wednesday.“It’s such a great relief to finally be returning to our country and to our families in good health. On board the ship, we were allowed to breathe fresh air for hardly a couple of hours every day. Amid the looming threat of contracting the virus, many among us were on the verge of depression. We are thankful to the government of India for making arrangements to bring us back to India,” Raikar told TOI from Japan’s Haneda airport before boarding the flight.However, it could be several days before Raikar and his fellow seamen are able to have a happy reunion with their families. The Indian crew members repatriated from Japan are likely to undergo 14 days of quarantine on their arrival in New Delhi.On Tuesday, the ambassador of India to Japan, Sanjay Kumar Verma, replied to commissioner for NRI affairs Narendra Sawaikar who had earlier written to him inquiring about the safety of the Goans on board the vessel assuring him that “arrangements for bringing them back to India are being made, and very soon they will be in their motherland”.The Indian embassy in Japan had on Tuesday announced that a chartered flight was being arranged to repatriate Indian nationals on board Diamond Princess, provided that they have given their consent, haven’t tested positive for coronavirus, and have been cleared by the medical team.Dixon Vaz, spokesperson of the Goan Seamen Association of India, had told TOI that the shipping company has promised to pay two months salary to all the crew members who were on board during this period.The vessel was quarantined when it arrived in Yokohama earlier this month after it emerged that a passenger who had disembarked in Hong Kong in January had tested positive for the respiratory illness. Altogether 16 Indians on board the vessel tested positive for the virus and were being hospitalised, it was informed.

Title: Man held for threatening to bomb Ajmer dargah
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Ajmer: Police arrested a person from Jaipur for threatening to bomb the Dargah of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty if the Pakistani delegation arrives in Ajmer.

The threat was given to district collector on landline by the accused Sandeep Panwar, a resident of Arai in Ajmer district. Police said they are investigating the matter, but preliminary probe suggests that the man was frustrated over electricity to his home being disconnected despite paying the dues.

According to police, district collector Vishwa Mohan Sharma got a threat call in which the accused said he would bomb the dargah. The matter was reported to SP, Ajmer, and the call was traced by the cyber cell. Later, an FIR was registered at Civil Lines police station. The call was traced to Panwar who was in Jaipur. Police nabbed him and brought him to Ajmer. The accused works in Surat in Gujarat and recently came to his village Arai. He claimed he spoke to officials of electricity department, but in vain. When he read the story of a Pakistani delegation coming to Ajmer, he decided to scare the administration and attract their attention. He claimed he was drunk when he made the threat call, police said.

Title: Centre rejects Punjab’s 100m Sukhna ESZ proposal
Content:
File photo of Sukhna Lake

CHANDIGARH: The ministry of environment, forest and climate change has turned down the Punjab government’s proposal to declare only 100-metre-deep eco-sensitive zone (ESZ) around the Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary in the area falling under it, in a major victory for the UT administration.Recently, Punjab chief minister Amarinder Singh had written to the government backing the proposal made in 2013. On the other hand, UT chief conservator of forests (CCF) Debendra Dalai had written a letter to the director general of forests and special secretary, ministry of environment, forest and climate change, opposing the proposal.The letter sent by the ministry to the Punjab government stated, “As far as the views of this ministry are concerned, we had advised the Punjab government to consider extending the ESZ to at least 1 km and submit the revised proposal.” “In this background and keeping in view of the order of Supreme Court dated November 5, 2019, on the Tata Camelot project, it is requested to provide your specific comments on the issues raised by Chandigarh to expedite the process of publication of ESZ notification”.The administration has already notified leaving 2km to 2.75km radius around the sanctuary as ESZ. The ministry had also issued a final notification on an ESZ around the sanctuary for Chandigarh but Punjab and Haryana have so far not declared these zones in their jurisdictions. The UT is pushing for the two to leave a matching area from the lake boundary as restricted development zone.The UT, in a letter on January 14, stated, “The ESZ for the area around Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary falling in Chandigarh has already been notified by the ministry on January 18, 2017, wherein the ESZ has been kept 2km to 2.75 km. However, the proposal of Punjab is not in line with that of Chandigarh”. The letter further stated, “It is to reiterate that a similar proposal of the Punjab government sent to the government in 2015 was not accepted. During 2018, the government once again turned down the proposal of Punjab proposing only 100m width as ESZ from the sanctuary. In case only 100m is left, it will have an adverse impact on the sanctuary as well as Sukhna Lake .”The UT had requested the ministry not to accept Punjab’s proposal in the interest of wildlife conservation in Sukhna Wildlife Sanctuary as well as for the conservation of Sukhna Lake, which is being declared as Wetlands (Conservation and Management) Rules 2017, for which a draft notification has already been issued.

Title: Paddy fields in Krishna delta get green cover
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Vijayawada: The paddy fields in the 150-year-old Krishna delta have received a green cover for the first time in a decade with farmers cultivating the second crop.

Farmers in the Krishna delta, spread over Krishna, Guntur, Prakasam and West Godavari districts, are busy with Rabi crop thanks to incessant rains in the upstream and subsequent floods this monsoon. Out of the 13.08 lakh acres of cultivable land in Krishna delta, farmers have grown Rabi crop in 5,07,685 acres. “The Kharif crop was good due to availability of water and its judicious maintenance,” said M V S Nagi Reddy, vice-chairman, AP Agriculture Mission.

Compared with the 15.17 lakh acres in 2019, this year Rabi crop was cultivated in 19.15 lakh acres. “Farming in parts of Krishna and West Godavari districts had come down because of conversion of paddy fields into aqua farms. We are also focusing on aqua promotion and allow farmers to draw water for aqua farms from paddy fields. The used water from paddy fields is drawn for aqua cultivation,” Nagi Reddy added, claiming that better water management helped farmers in both ways.

“We were able to store some water in Pulichintala project last monsoon, besides giving water to the Nagarjuna Sagar right canal which covers parts of Guntur and Prakasam districts. This year, Rabi was cultivated in 45,000 acres in Prakasam district,” said the Agriculture Mission chairman.

He said aqua farms spread over 1.71 lakh acres in the Krishna delta benefited from release of water for Rabi. “Chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy is concerned about agriculture. The Agriculture Mission is very much helpful to the state agriculture sector in general and farmers in particular,” said Nagi Reddy, who is also a former member of Indian Council of Agriculture Research (ICAR).

Title: Collector tells Goa University to check deputy speaker’s son’s degree
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative Image

PANAJI: The North Goa collector has asked Goa University to ascertain the validity of the Bachelor of Arts (BA) degree submitted by deputy speaker Isidore Fernandes’s son Raymond while applying for the post of awal karkun.

Raymond’s degree is from Lucknow-based Bhartiya Shiksha Parishad, where he claims to have completed his BA in 2007.

Activist Aires Rodrigues had filed a complaint before chief secretary Parimal Rai seeking a probe into the selection process for the post of awal karkun by the North Goa collectorate.

“There is no inquiry. We are just following process and we have asked Goa University whether the University where the candidate studied is recognized or not,” additional collector Gopal Parsekar said.

Rodrigues’ complaint states that he had “enough reason to believe that the certificates of educational qualifications submitted by Raymond Fernandes are forged and fabricated.”

While calling for the inquiry into the authenticity of the certificates submitted by Raymond, Rodrigues also demanded that Goa Public Service Commission should evaluate the candidate’s abilities.

The activist said that according to the University Grants Commission (UGC), the Bhartiya Shiksha Parishad in Lucknow is unrecognised and functioning in violation of Section 2(f) and Section 3 of the UGC Act, 1956.

The advocate also alleged that revenue minister Jennifer Monseratte compelled authorities to leak the exam question paper to Raymond. “Raymond Fernandes was given prior access to the question paper of the written test held on January 18, this year, for the post of awal karkun,” Rodrigues said

Title: NMC’s Nashik bus service: Transport minister promises full co-operation
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The state transport department has assured the Nashik Municipal Corporation ( NMC ) full co-operation for the city bus service project that is expected to begin from April 1, 2020.

State transport minister Anil Parab informed civic chief Radhakrishna Game that the state transport department will give its nod to the civic body to start the city bus service project. As per norms, it is mandatory for any civic body to take permission of the state transport department for starting a bus service project.

On Wednesday, district guardian minister Chhagan Bhujbal chaired a meeting regarding the city bus service project with Parab and Game in Mumbai on Wednesday.

“The state transport minister has assured us that he will depute five senior officials from Maharashtra State Road Transport Corporation (MSRTC) to the NMC to assist the civic body in running the city bus service project without hiccup,” Game said.

“The minister has also assured that necessary permission from the state government to run the city bus service will be shortly given to the NMC. We have also demanded the transport minister to allow NMC to use the infrastructure of MSRTC for its city bus service project,” he added.

The civic chief also urged the transport minister to give the Anandnagar bus depot for the city bus service at nominal rate. “Moreover, we also urged the minister for joint use of four terminals of MSRTC — Nimani, Adgaon, Satpur and Nashik Road. The minister has given his nod for the purpose,” Game said.

The NMC has a plan to run 400 city buses — 200 CNG, 150 electric and 50 diesel — under the city bus project. All the 400 buses are to be operated and maintained by three private contractors. The NMC has already signed an agreement for 250 CNG and diesel buses, while it is yet to sign an agreement with the contractor for running the electric buses.

“We have urged the Centre to give us subsidy for buying 100 electric buses. We will run all 150 electric buses in phases if the Centre gives its nod to provide for subsidy,” Game said.

Title: Fisherfolk oppose draft fisheries bill
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Madurai: Fisherfolk of Kanyakumari district unanimously showed a strong opposition to the draft National Marine Fisheries (Regulation and Management) Bill, 2019 at a public meeting organised by the district administration and fisheries department at the Kanyakumari district collectorate on Wednesday. Tense moments prevailed as the participants, including women, resorted to sloganeering to drop the bill as it will affect their livelihood.

The participants engaged in a heated argument with the officials and the situation was brought under control after district collector Prashant M Wadnere gave the participants an option to peacefully raise their issues of concern so that it can be forwarded to the ministry concerned.

Fisherfolk and the representatives of fishermen bodies such as South Asian Fishermen Fraternity (SAFF), International Fishermen Development Trust (INFIDET), mechanised boats and country craft fishermen unions and Neithal Makkal Iyakkam have highlighted various aspects of the draft that will affect the livelihood of the coastal people. INFIDET president Justin Antony said that it has sent shock waves among the fishermen as they will have to obtain permission from regulatory officials on a daily-basis even for fishing within a miniscule range of 12 nautical miles from the shore. “For deep sea fishermen from this region it takes 20 to 45 days for a fishing expedition. How can they get daily permits?” he questioned.

Calling the act practically impossible, he said that the existing practices are already stringent enough to monitor the fishermen.

Title: Ex-UP governor Aziz Qureshi booked for ‘provocative’ speech during anti-CAA protest meet
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Bareilly: Former Uttar Pradesh governor Aziz Qureshi has been booked for what UP police said a “provocative” speech delivered during an anti-CAA protest meeting in Moradabad on February 22. “After verification of video recording, it has been found that the former governor indeed delivered a provocative speech. So, an FIR has been registered against him,” said Moradabad’s superintendent of police (SP) Amit Kumar Anand.

The SP said that Qureshi reached Eidgah ground in Moradabad, where a sit-in protest was being held since January 29, and “stoked sentiments” of the protestors with his speech.

The police officer said that the FIR was filed under IPC sections 143 (punishment for unlawful assembly), 145 (joining unlawful assembly), 149 (every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object) and 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant) at Gulshaheed police station on Teusday.

Qureshi-- now chairman of Madhya Pradesh Urdu Academy-- reached Moradabad to extend his support to the protestors.

He could be purportedly heard in the video clip saying, “Our Constitution guarantees social, economic and political justice to each and everybody irrespective of any caste and creed of the nation.

“They have killed the spirit of the Constitution and insulted the people who had drafted it. Why did they do it? Amit Shah and Narendra Modi have one aim to achieve, and that is to turn this country into a Hindu nation. And to achieve this goal, they are using every possible way from abusing Pakistan to carrying out air-strike and frightening people in the name of Pakistan.

“All they are doing is to divide the nation on communal lines. And it is the first step to show that by introducing a law they have sidelined 20crore population of Muslims in the country,” Qureshi said.

Title: State employees’ sit-in enters 3rd day
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

On the call of All Rajasthan State Employees’ Joint Federation (Unified), the sit-in of the state employees continued at District Collectorate Jaipur for the third day on Wednesday. A five-member delegation presented a nine-point demand letter for the CM to the collector.

Title: Nashik Municipal Corporation allots Rs 40 crore to build flyover on Trimbak Road
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

The flyover will be built near the Mico circle on Trimbak Road in the city

NASHIK: A new flyover is set to come up at the busy Trimbak Road as the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC) is expected to start the construction work soon.

The flyover will be built near the Mico circle on Trimbak Road in the city.

The civic administration has increased the financial provision for the flyover project from Rs 15 crore to Rs 40 crore as the project will now be extended beyond two traffic signals — Hotel Green view and Hotel Sibal — on the said stretch.

The project was, in fact, proposed in the last year’s budget with the provision of Rs 15 crore; however, it did not start.

NMC officials said that the work was delayed as the Nashik Metro corridor was supposed to pass through the same stretch and the Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited had sought the flyover plan from municipal corporation.

According to NMC sources, the metro corridor would be constructed over the flyover.

“Maha Metro had sought information about the NMC’s proposed flyover on Mico circle along with its height. We have given all the details to the Maha Metro which includes the plan to construct the corridor for Nashik Metro project. This corridor is to be constructed above the NMC’s flyover,” a senior Public Works Department official said.

“The proposed corridor of Nashik Metro had delayed the work of flyover on Mico Circle. Now, we have also planned to extend the length of the flyover up to the second traffic junction from Mico Circle on Trimbak Road,” said an NMC official.

Maha Metro has proposed to build Nashik Metro project at the cost of Rs 2,100 crore. The state cabinet has already given approval to the detailed project report which has been sent to the Centre for approval.

The rubber tyre-based coaches have been planned under the Nashik Metro project and two elevated corridors with total length of 32 kms have been proposed in the city.

The first corridor will be from Gangapur to Mumbai Naka with total length of 10 km. It will include 10 stations —Gangapur, Jalapur, Ganpat Nagar, Kale Nagar, Jehan Circle, Thatte Nagar, Shivaji Nagar, Panchavati, CBS and Mumbai Naka.

The second corridor will pass via the Mico Circle. The second corridor will connect Gangapur to Nashik Road via Mico Circle, having total length of 22 km. It will include 15 stations — Dhruv Nagar, Shramik Nagar, Mahindra, Shaneshwar Nagar, Satpur Colony, MIDC, ABB Circle, Parijat Nagar, MICO circle, CBS, Sharda Circle, Dwarka Circle, Gayatri Nagar, Samta Nagar, Gandhi Nagar, Nehru Nagar, Datta Mandir and Nashik Road.

Title: Chennai: Battered by flooding, Sunnambu Kolathur residents hope PWD will build retaining wall
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

A neighbourhood in Sunnambu Kolathur off Pallavaram-Thoraipakkam radial road that was flooded during the 2017 ... Read More

CHENNAI: Residents living in low-lying areas off Pallavaram-Thoraipakkam radial road between Keelkattalai lake and Narayanapuram lake are hopeful that authorities will honour their promise of building a retaining wall along the stretch to prevent flooding in the area.

The public works department (PWD) has begun work on the project from Narayanapuram lake. On Sunday, PWD officials addressed the residents of Sunnambu Kolathur and explained the technical details of the project and assured them of bringing a comprehensive flood mitigation plan for the neighbourhood.

“For three continuous years since 2015, we were affected by floods. The water from Keelkattalai lake passes through the surplus canal and excess water from the canal floods the neighbourhood. Even last year when there was less rain, the canal was brimming,” said J Sankar, a resident who has been petitioning the authorities seeking action.

More than 1,000 families reside in Sunnambu Kolathur, according to the Federation of Sunnambu Kolathur Residents Welfare Association.

Apart from explaining about the project, PWD officials promised the public that necessary action will be taken to stop sewage being let out into the surplus canal, according to residents who were part of the meeting. “We will not allow even an inch of encroachment,” a PWD official said, adding that a comprehensive flood mitigation plan for the area will be announced soon by the chief minister to construct a retaining wall up to Keelkattalai lake.

Officials said the initial stretch from Narayanapuram lake till a few hundred metres from the water body is expected to be completed by June.

“Constructing a house in floodplains or a low-lying area is not a public mistake. It is the collective responsibility of all departments and now we have to find a solution,” the PWD official said.

Apart from surplus water from the canal, another issue faced by the residents is encroachments which too was addressed recently.

Two months ago, revenue department officials too had surveyed encroachments after complaints from residents that ingress and egress from the residential areas to the radial road has been cut off due to the encroachments. “In 2015, people had to jump walls to get to the 200-feet road to get relief materials,” recalled a resident of Raja Nagar.

Title: EOW arrests accountant for Rs 1.5 crore PF and ESIC fraud
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: A 43-year old accountant employed with a private security company has been arrested by the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) for allegedly siphoning off with company’s Rs 1.5 crore kept aside to deposit in ESIC and PF accounts.

The arrested accused has been identified as Omprakash Singh, who is an ex-serviceman and resident of Padegaon area of the city. He was produced before the court and remanded to further police custody.

The Osmanapura police said the accused was employed as an accountant with the SMK Global Security Solutions Pvt Ltd at its office situated at Doodh Dairy square, on Jalna road.

As per the complaint registered with the police, the suspect has been working since inception with the company that was started by Karbhari Jadhavar in 2009. In July 2019, the company management received a communication from the bank that company’s account is being sealed for failing to make ESIC payment of company’s employees.

With this arrest, the EOW has now launched a manhunt of a woman suspect, who was a former employee of the security company.

Both Singh and another woman employee held key positions in the company, the suspects allegedly submitted forged documents and challans to substantiate their claim of punctually making PF and ESIC payments.

The company management produced these documents before the relevant authorities, only to learn that they are forged. An internal probe by the company revealed that the suspects even siphoned off with the portion of money meant for employees’ salaries.

Title: Chadar offered on behalf of PM Narendra Modi
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

PM Narendra Modi

AJMER: Union minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi on Wednesday offered a chadar on behalf of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and read his message for devotees coming to attend the 808th yearly urs of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty calling for ‘unity and harmony’.

The PM’s message read, “I congratulate to all the devotees, spread all over the world, of Khwaja Moinuddin Chishty on the occasion of 808th Urs. The great Sufi saint who gave the message of humanity to the world, I pay homage to him. India is the country of vast spiritual traditions. Sufis and saints have created the culture of India with their thoughts, which helps make this country strong. The message of peace and unity has made our lives harmonious.”

People from all religions and faiths gathered to welcome the chadar of Prime Minister Modi. Meanwhile, Naqvi briefed about the programmes started for minorities in the country as well as the projects taken up by the dargah committee in Ajmer .

There is a beeline for offering chadars in the dargah during yearly Urs. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray sent a chadar through chairman of Mumbai Nagar Palika Rahul Kanal on Wednesday. The chadar was offered with a procession to dargah and hundreds of Shiv Sena members participated in it. In a message read out in dargah, Thackeray sought prosperity, harmony and peace in the country. A chadar from Bollywood was also offered.

Title: IGP orders probe into alleged framing of innocent man
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Ravinder Kumar Singal, the Aurangabad range special inspector general of police (IGP), has ordered a high-level inquiry against Jalna police’s anti-dacoity squad (ADS) and officers of Kadim Jalna police station for allegedly framing a man in a case of ‘preparing for a dacoity’.

The alleged framing of the man — a commerce graduate holding a diploma in education veterinary science — resulted in him being taken on remand by the police of three different districts, Aurangabad rural, Osmanabad and Ahmednagar, to investigate house break-in and theft cases.

After staying behind bars between January 3 and February 14, the man reached out to the range IGP and lodged a complaint against the police.

When contacted, Singal said, “Allegations of framing an innocent man are very serious and we have ordered an inquiry into it by a young IPS officer. We cannot let men in uniform ruin lives of innocent people. Those found guilty will face stringent action.”

As per a complaint submitted by Anil Goraknath Walekar, a vehicle belonging to one of his relatives was stolen and the family had lodged a complaint at Kadim Jalna police station in September 2019.

One of Walekar’s friend promised to help him find the vehicle and in return, asked for a party at a dhaba. On January 3, when Walekar and two of his friends were eating at the Shivneri dhaba on Rajur road, they were joined by two policemen from the Kadim Jalna police station.

After having food and liquor together, the policemen took the trio to the police station. While one of the men was released, the remaining two, including Walekar, were handed over to the ADS team that took them to the office of the Jalna superintendent of police.

The ADS then registered an offence stating that in the wee hours of January 4, their patrolling team spotted a group of armed suspects near the Global Gurukul School in Jalna and arrested four of them with sharp weapons and articles required for committing dacoities.

After getting bail, Walekar filed an RTI seeking CCTV footage of the Kadim Jalna police station as well as of the Jalna SP office, but his plea was turned down citing security reasons.

The man then reached the dhaba where he and his friends had food and liquor with the policemen before being detained.

He managed to obtain the CCTV footage from that place. Using this footage, he reached out to the Jalna police to lodge a complaint, but no complaint was registered. Eventually, he went to Singal who the ordered a probe.

On Wednesday, a team led by assistant superintendent of police Gorakh Bhamre reached Jalna and initiated the investigation against the police officers and their subordinates in the ADS and Kadim Jalna police station.

Title: Separate council for Satara & Deolai: MLC
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Satish Chavan

AURANGABAD: Council member Satish Chavan demanded the urban development minister to establish a separate municipal council for Satara Deolai villages, which were merged with the Aurangabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) in 2016.

This was done so that these areas get government funds for development.

Raising the issue in the legislative council on Wednesday, Chavan and other MLCs from the region said in 2016 when Satara-Deolai had a population of 1 lakh, the government had granted these villages municipal council status. Soon, the government merged these villages with the civic body of Aurangabad city and had turned them into two wards.

The elections conducted and corporators were also elected. Chavan said that no big development works were carried out in these two villages and no facilities were provided. The area lacks roads, drainage, drinking water and other civic amenities. He demanded separate municipal corporation for the two villages so that the residents could avail various facilities. The government would also provide financial support to the council for development works.

In his reply, the urban development minister Eknath Shinde for now ruled out any such possibility, but said that provisions would be made for the area for development. A meeting of officials and the guardian minister will be convened on the issue to ensure the newly included civic body areas are developed properly, he said. Shinde added that so far 42 different development works were being carried out in Satara Deolai at a cost of Rs 1.98 crore.

Title: Rajasthan high court clears hurdles for panchayat polls
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

JODHPUR: In a major relief to the exercise of panchayat election and lotteries for the reserved categories on the posts of ward panch, sarpanch , member panchayat samiti, member zila parishad and pradhan, the Rajasthan High Court here on Wednesday dismissed all applications challenging the process.

With all the petitions dismissed, the state government and the state election commission would now be able to proceed with their respective exercises for the fourth phase of panchayat elections as directed by the Supreme Court in an earlier order. The apex court had directed that the elections be held in second half of April.

The single bench of justice Arun Bhansali stated, “Order passed by the State Election Commission dated 9/1/2020 and order passed by the state dated 24/1/2020 and subsequent orders thereto do no call for any interference.” The court rejected the individual challenges raised against the draw of lotteries for lack of any substance.

Petitioners Vijay Singh and others challenged the initiation of lottery schedule in the state, a 3-day exercise started from January 31, ordered by the government on January 24, for the purpose of determination of reservation of various posts ahead of the panchayat election. The petition stated, “The election process initiated by the Election Commission pursuant to the notification dated December 26, 2019 is still in progress and has only been deferred by order dated January 9, 2020. Since no specific order has been passed by the EC in this regard, the move of the government for drawing of lottery for purpose of reservation etc. is premature and the same cannot be countenanced.”

Petitioner’s counsel Moti Singh argued in the court that the said order with pending election process, which has only been deferred, was interference in the process, hence could not be permitted.

Title: Fire NOC must for registering PGs in Chandigarh: Governor V P Singh Badnore
Content:
V P Singh Badnore

TimesView Making a no-objection certificate from the fire department mandatory for registration of any paying guest (PG) accommodation in the city and amending the policy by incorporating clauses like annual building inspection and registration are all steps in the right direction. Unfortunately, all these measures only apply if a guest facility is registered. The latest fire accident has already brought to light the ground reality that only a minuscule percentage of such facilities are registered. The first step towards addressing the issue would be to ensure registration. The RWAs could play a key role in this by identifying the illegal set-ups in their area.

‘Not a single PG sealed in city’

CHANDIGARH: Punjab governor-cum-UT administrator V P Singh Badnore on Wednesday issued directions to make no objection certificate (NOC) from the fire department mandatory before registering paying guest (PG) accommodations in the city.Badnore, who was holding a meeting of senior UT officials, expressed concern over the loss of three lives in the recent fire incident in Sector 32, and directed officials to ensure regular police inspection of PGs.The administration, meanwhile, has started the process to revise its PG policy. The UT is planning to include important points like annual inspection of building and annual registration and scrap one-time registration.A special desk has already been formed in the estate office for the registration of PGs, a senior UT official said. “Assistant estate officer will look after it,” deputy commissioner Mandip Singh Brar said.On Wednesday, the UT estate office came out with a fresh proforma for the registration of PGs in Chandigarh , in which occupancy certificate of the building was made mandatory.The occupancy certificate, issued by the estate office, shows that the building has been made as per permissible building bylaws of the administration. Besides, the building owner, while applying for registration, must submit additional details like floor wise capacity for paying guests, and total accommodation available in the building. The estate office also released the list of 23 registered PGs in Chandigarh, which includes seven in Sector 35, four in Sector 36, three in Sector 15, two in Sector 21 and one each in sectors 11, 22, 27, 28, 34, 37 and 40.With the 2013 amendment in the Chandigarh building bylaws allowing even 7.5 marla houses to keep PGs — earlier only 10 marlas and above could offer their place — this business is booming in the city. In the last six months, the UT estate office had issued notices to 145 owners for violations, but failed to seal even a single PG.By not registering PGs, building owners are also evading commercial water and power charges. They continue to pay domestic water and power charges, which are very less as compared to commercial charges.The estate office can even impose penalties on the building owners for violating rules and seal PGs. According to the rates of misuse, for non-permitted trade in the commercial category, the rate of penalty is Rs 8 per square foot while in the industrial category it is Rs 10 per square foot.

Title: Notices served to 92 industrial units for air pollution
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

NASHIK: The Maharashtra Pollution Control Board ( MPCB ) recently served notices to 92 industrial units of the Ambad and Satpur industrial estates to pay fines for causing air pollution since 2015.

The Satpur and Ambad industrial estates of the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) are located in the jurisdiction of the Nashik Municipal Corporation (NMC).

MPCB sources said 87 small industrial units, three medium-scale units and two large industrial units have got the notices. A penalty of Rs 25 lakh is to be recovered from small industrial units, Rs 50 from medium and Rs 1 crore from the large industrial units. Cumulatively, fine of Rs 25.25 crore is expected to be recovered.

Nashik Industries and Manufacturers’ Association (Nima) has alleged that the MPCB has taken wrong decisions hurriedly under pressure. “The MPCB should have sent show-cause notices informing the industries about the air pollution caused by them. However, it hurriedly sent notices seeking penalties. This is wrong,” said Tushar Chavan, the Nima secretary.

“How will the industrial units pay such heavy penalties to the MPCB. Such actions will affect the industrial growth of the district. We are also seeking legal opinion on the issue” he added.

Chavan said that the Nima had recently called a meeting of all the 92 industrial units in the Nima office. “We have asked all the industries to submit their reply to the notice so that there will not be any legal hurdle in future. Moreover, we have also decided to move the court on the issue against the MPCB decision,” he added.

Chavan also alleged that the MPCB has sent notices hurriedly to the industrial units that are green and have not sent notices to those that are actually causing air pollution.

Title: Bodies of woman and daughter wash ashore at Pulicat estuary
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Chennai: A week after a family of four went missing, bodies of the mother and daughter washed ashore at Pulicat even as the search for the father and son continued. Police said the family faced a land dispute issue with one of their relatives and it was suspected that they entered into a suicide pact .

According to police, Ravi, 49, of Kokkupalayam near Gummidipoondi in Tiruvallur was staying with his wife Veerammal, 47, and children Balamurali, 25 and Deivayani, 24. Police said Ravi and his brother Siva had a dispute over a property and lodged separate complaints at the Arambakkam police station two months ago. Police called the two families to the station.

On February 20, the family had gone to a temple and did not return home for two days. Ravi’s elder brother Ramadoss who searched for them, panicked and lodged a complaint at the Arambakkam police station. However, on Monday the bodies of the two women washed ashore at the Pulicat estuary .

Inquiries with neighbours revealed that the family was upset about the property dispute and expressed suicidal tendencies. The Thirupalaivanam police registered a case and with the help of Ramadoss identified the bodies as those of Veerammal and Deivayani.

The bodies were sent for postmortem examination at Ponneri government hospital.

Title: In J&K, Central laws to be under concurrent list
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

NEW DELHI: The Union Cabinet on Wednesday paved the way for implementation of all central laws under the Concurrent List with required modification and amendments for the Union Territory of J&K.

After the abrogation of Article 370 of the Constitution that removed special status given to the erstwhile state of J&K, all central laws have now been made applicable to the UT of J&K effective from October 31, 2019 .

“All the Central laws which are applicable to whole of India except the erstwhile state of J&K before appointed date of October 31, 2019 are now applicable to the UT. Further, it is necessary to adapt the central laws made under the Concurrent List,” a press note said.

“Accordingly, the Cabinet in its meeting today has approved the proposal for issuance of an order by the Central government for adaptation and modifications of 37 such Central laws that are made applicable to UT of J&K,” the note said.

The Cabinet decision is intended to remove any ambiguity in application of central laws in J&K. As per section 96 of the J&K Reorganisation Act, 2019, the central government has powers to make adaptations and modifications of the laws, whether by way of repeal or amendment for the application of any law made before the appointed date till the expiration of one year from the appointed date in relation to the successor Union Territories.

Title: Two cousins killed, 10 injured in road accident in Pilibhit
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Pilibhit: Two cousins astride a motorcycle were killed and another pillion rider injured after the rider lost control over the vehicle and fell into a roadside ditch on Gajraula-Barkhera road near Karod police outpost on Wednesday afternoon.

Police shifted the victims, hailing from Aliyapur village under Barkhera police station, to the Pilibhit district government hospital, where doctors proclaimed the duo dead on arrival, while the survivor is undergoing treatment. The bodies were sent for postmortem.

SHO Umesh Kumar Solanki said the deceased were identified as Nand Ram (22) and Pradeep Kumar (23) and the survivor as Ganga Charan (25), all residents of Aliyapur village.

They trio was on their way home after attending a wedding at Ugnapur village under Gajraula police station late Tuesday night when the accident took place.

In a separate accident, as many as nine people sustained injuries after three motorcycles collided on the Bareilly-Haridwar national highway 74 near Bahuni Crossing under Amaria police station on Wednesday evening.

SHO Udai Veer Singh said an FIR would be registered after they received a complaint.

The SHO said the accident took place when four members of a family, including a one-year-old girl hailing from Bhojipura in Bareilly district were on their way home on bikes. In a bid to save them from a speeding truck, they collided with a bike coming from the opposite direction, said the SHO.

Meanwhile, the third bike also rammed into the two bikes, injuring the rider and his wife.

The injured were rushed to the community health centre in Amaria, where doctor referred six of them to the district hospital in view of serious injuries.

Title: 45-year-old kills parents, dies in mishap an hour later
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Jaipur: A 45-year-old man in Nagaur killed his parents in the early hours of Wednesday only to die in a road accident just an hour later.

According to initial probe, the man was unemployed and under financial crunch because of which he took this step. The deceased were identified as Ruga Ram and Patasi Devi, both in their 80s, and their son Hanuman Singh. The incident is of Bhadana village in Sadar police station area.

Mukul Sharma, circle officer, Nagaur, told TOI, “An accident was reported early on Wednesday and when we identified the victim as Hanuman Singh, it led us to the double murder of his parents who he allegedly killed with the wooden handle of an axe by striking them on the head.”

Following this, the accused left on his bike and was hit by a heavy vehicle due to which he died on the spot, the official said. “It is still unclear if it was accident or suicide as it appears that Hanuman came in the middle of the road and was hit by the heavy vehicle. We are looking for the vehicle to confirm our theory that the accused panicked after killing his parents and possibly committed suicide, though it cannot be said with certainty as of now,” Sharma added. The motive behind the murder is also unclear.

Title: Slur on social media: Actor lodges complaint against pizza firm staff
Content: CHENNAI: Actor Gayathri Sai has approached the Teynampet all-women police seeking action against an employee of Domino’s Pizza who she said posted her phone number, underlined ‘item’, on social networking sites. The employee, who police identified as Parameswaran, has since been sacked by his employer. He has been detained.Gayathri Sai, who made her debut in Mani Ratnam ’s ‘ Anjali ’, told TOI she had ordered pizza from Domino’s and Parameswaran was assigned to deliver it at her Teynampet residence. While trying to locate the house, he called her a few times for directions.“Since he could not locate the address, he began speaking rudely and said he would take back the pizza if I did not speak properly to him,” she said.However, he finally delivered the pizza. The actor said she took a picture of him to lodge a complaint with the company.The next day, Gayathri said, she began receiving calls on her cellphone from men seeking sexual favours.“When I received a message from a man and asked him why he had sent it, he told me my mobile number was being circulated on social networking sites,”she said. She then checked social media sites and lodged a complaint with the Teynampet all-women police, submitted the audio recordings of the callers and their phone numbers.Police began investigations and found that the pizza delivery man was behind it and informed the actor.“This kind of harassment is a threat to all women who are living alone, as most of them order food online,” said Gayathri Sai.A senior police officer said they had been calling her to the police station to help in the investigations but that she was refusing to co-operate.Meanwhile, a statement from a spokesperson of Jubilant FoodWorks Limited, which owns the Domino’s Pizza brand, said, “We were extremely shocked to hear about this incident. As soon as we were informed, we immediately initiated the termination process as per applicable laws. As a responsible corporate house, we have zero tolerance for such behaviour and strongly condemn it. We stand by our guest and are extending our full cooperation to police for investigation.”Gayathri Sai, a former Femina Miss Chennai Runner-up who ran a boutique in Hong Kong, had earlier levelled accusations of sexual misconduct against a senior Chennai-based journalist.The 42-year-old actor then went live on her Facebook page, detailing the harassment she had been subjected to for more than two years.In Video: Tamil actress alleges pizza delivery boy shared her number on adult chat groups, files police complaint

Title: Activists demand double-line between Parbhani-Manmad via Aurangabad
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Railway activists and passengers have demanded a double line between Parbhani-Manmad via Aurangabad , as the South Central Railway (SCR) has completed the final phase of the double line between Mudkhed – Parbhani.

The survey for the proposed double-line between Parbhani and Manmad has been already completed in the first half of 2017, but the infrastructural work found no mention in the past budgets, including the latest railway budget.

While the doubling of the Daund-Manmad line was approved by the railway board around three years ago, the proposed doubling work between Parbhani and Manmad, of nearly 290km, was not granted.

Railway activist Omprakash Varma said, “It is an important route which witnesses running of several major long-distance trains. The railway authorities should lay the double-line on the desired route without wasting time,” he said.

Another railway activist Raj Somani, “The doubling of the line would help in reducing the travel time. It would increase the movement of passengers and goods,” he said.

When contacted, a senior SCR official, preferring anonymity, said the necessary survey work for doubling the line between Parbhani and Manmad railway was already done. “The survey report is being put up before the railway board for a necessary policy decision. The line-doubling on Parbhani and Manmad route is essential and it will be accomplished by completing necessary formalities,” he said.

Public relations officer of SCR (Nanded division), Rajesh Shinde said. “Three major junctions fall on Mudkhed-Parbhani track. Earlier, certain trains witnessed crossing delays, but the track-doubling will address the issue,”

The Mudkhed – Parbhani double line project with a distance of 81.43 km was sanctioned in 2012-13 with an estimated cost of Rs. 390 Crore. As per the plan charted out by the SCR, the crucial project was executed in five phases.

Title: Indian crew disembark from Diamond Princess in Japan
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Madurai: “It is good to be out of the ship at last,” said a relieved Indian crew member after emerging from the quarantined cruise ship Diamond Princess at Yokohama in Japan on Wednesday. About 120 crew members from India had disembarked from the ship on Wednesday evening after weeks of confinement in the ship after hundreds of passengers and crew on board were infected by COVID-19 early this month.

After disembarking, they were taken by road in four buses from Yokohama port to Haneda airport, from where they were flown to Delhi in a chartered Air India flight. They will be under mandatory quarantine for 14 days in India before they are sent to their homes.

The nearly 3,700 crew and passengers who were on board when the ship was quarantined included 138 Indians – 132 crew members and six passengers. In all, 16 Indians tested positive for COVID-19 and were disembarked from the ship for treatment.

Among the Indian crew who disembarked on Wednesday were five from Tamil Nadu – Anbalagan of Madurai, Muthu of Trichy, Daniel of Chengalpattu, Dhamodharan of Tuticorin and Jayaraj of Coimbatore.

“We were waiting for the captain’s announcement even before dawn on Wednesday. Finally, at around around 3pm, the announcement came. While we were earlier told that we will have to undergo basic checkup for symptoms of cold, cough or fever, we did not have such hassles while disembarking,” Anbalagan told TOI.

He added that they will be under mandatory quarantine for 14 days in the National Security Guard (NSG) camp at Manesar in Gurgaon district, Haryana. “We are happy to return to India. Our company has assured to take care of us during the quarantine period,” he added.

The crew members said that Japanese defence personnel and officials from the Indian embassy in Japan were present during the disembarkation process. “They maintained safe distance from us and checked our passports,” said a crew.

Wearing masks, the relieved crew were glued to their mobile phones, informing their family and friends about their return. The crew members hoped that Diamond Princess will be disinfected and wished to get back to work soon.

Title: AP 2nd state in country to set up cyclone warning system
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Vijayawada: The Early Warning Dissemination System (EWDS), set up by the AP state disaster management authority (APSDMA) at a cost of Rs 87 crore, was inaugurated by home minister Mekathoti Sucharitha on Wednesday. The EWDS can sustain a wind speed of 250 kilometres per hour during super cyclones.

The home minister said Andhra Pradesh is the second state in the country to be equipped with an advanced mechanism of the early cyclone warning system.

“During natural calamities like floods, cyclones and lightning strikes, the early warning system will help in shifting people to safer places, thereby reducing the loss of human life. Use of technology during natural calamities is always recommended and also helps in the progress of state’s economy. Through the early warning system, the public would be sent alerts to shift to safer places during natural disasters, besides giving time to the administration to prepare in advance and take up rescue operations effectively,” she said.

The Early Warning Dissemination System (EWDS) has been enabled in 76 mandals, 16 fish landing centres and eight tourism destinations in nine coastal districts across the state.

Principal secretary V Usha Rani said the new routers, servers, digital mobile radios, work stations, satellite terminals, electronic sirens have been equipped in the cyclone warning centres as part of the Early Warning Dissemination System (EWDS) project.

Title: Govt to chalk out energy export policy
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Vijayawada: The state government on Wednesday decided to chalk out energy export policy to create an encouraging atmosphere for increasing power generation and attract more investments in energy sector.

At a review meeting on energy sector here in Wednesday, chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Reddy asked officials to explore opportunities to attract investments and increase employment opportunities in energy sector.

The meeting discussed a proposal to leasing land to industrial units. The CM said such a proposal would encourage setting up of industries in the state. He said farmers would get regular income and will get rights on the land permanently.

NTPC said it was ready to generate 1,000MW more and efforts were being made to provide them the required land. Jagan directed the officials to make setting up 10,000 MW solar power plants in the state a reality at the earliest. He also discussed the logistics for setting up solar power plants.

The CM directed the officials to complete feeder automation within the next two years for nine hours of uninterrupted power supply for agriculture sector.

Title: Panchkula: Gynaecologist, peon booked for taking Rs 20,000 for conducting abortion
Content:
Representative image

PANCHKULA: Police booked a gynaecologist and a peon posted at General Hospital, Sector 6, for allegedly accepting Rs 20,000 for conducting an abortion following an inquiry on Wednesday, four days after the complaint was received.Dr Sneh Singh, deputy civil surgeon, had lodged the complaint against Dr Poonam Bhargava, the gynaecologist and Baljinder, the peon, after receiving video clips from Amandeep Singh, a resident of Patiala, on February 20.The video filmed secretly by Amandeep on his mobile phone showed him meeting Dr Bhargava and telling her that his wife was pregnant with their third girl child and they wanted to abort it. In response, the doctor offered to carry out the abortion at their house in exchange of Rs 20,000.On Sunday, health minister Anil Vij ordered the gynaecologist’s suspension.Civil surgeon Dr Jasjeet Kaur had constituted a committee of six doctors, including Dr Sangeeta Singhal, Dr Umesh Modi, Dr Rani Singh, Dr Suresh Kumar, Dr Parvinder and Dr Saroj Aggarwal, to conduct the probe into the alleged facilitating of an illegal medical termination of pregnancy of a four-month foetus.The committee in its report submitted said the video clearly shows her intention to perform the MTP for Rs 20,000, despite being told that the woman already has two daughters and has come after a “test”.Police registered a case against Bhargava and the peon under Sections 3, 4 and 5 of the MTP Act, Section 27-B (ii) and 28 of Drugs and Cosmetic Act 1940 and different Sections of the Indian Penal Code at the Sector 5 police station.

Title: Five sugar mill workers killed, three injured in bus-SUV collision in Rampur
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Rampur: Five employees of Rana Sugar Mill, who were on the night patrolling to prevent the entry of unregistered sugarcane-laden vehicles for crushing, were killed and three others injured after the SUV they were travelling in collided head-on with a speeding bus near Bandar village under Shahbad kotwali in Rampur district early Wednesday morning.

According to police, the victims were identified as Amresh Puran, a resident of Chandusi in Sambhal district; Harbir Singh, a resident of Jasrath Pur village, Shivcharan of Chaukoni village, Amit of Mukutpur village under Moondapandey thesil — all in Moradabad district —and Diggu from Rasulpur village in Meerut.

Puran was posted as assistant cane manager at the mill, while Harbir, Jasrath and Shivcharan were supervisors, and Diggu was driver.

The three injured employees were shifted to a hospital by the mill management and police.

Meanwhile, district magistrate Aunjaneya Kumar Singh also visited the Rampur district hospital.

Speaking with TOI, Shahbad kotwali SHO Narendra Tyagi said, “The Bolero in which the employees of Rana Sugar Mill were travelling collided with a private bus on its way to Bijnore. We have impounded the bus and a manhunt to nab the bus driver has been launched. The bodies were handed over to the victims’ families after postmortem.”

Title: Fellowship in nature conservation
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Aurangabad: The Centre for Applied Research and People’s Engagement (CARPE) has invited application for a fellowship in nature conservation .

Titled Prakriti Research Fellowship, the programme will give an opportunity to work on independent projects with support from a well-known ecologist and an amount of Rs 2 lakh. “The fellowship will be offered under two categories. Projects located in Aurangabad division, whereas other category covers projects located across India, except Aurangabad division,” CARPE said in a release. tnn

Title: Madurai’s jigarthanda reaches Singapore for first time
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

MADURAI: While traditional snack items like murukku, kadalai mittai, karachevu and the Geographical Indication (GI) tagged Srivilliputtur palkova have frequently been exported due to their high demand in other countries, it is the first time that Madurai ’s famous drink jigarthanda has been flown to Singapore by an Air India flight on Wednesday.

S Thanga Pandian , customs clearance agent, said that traditional Indian sweets were in high demand in other countries and over the past few months, he had seen the exports of not less than 1,000 kg of traditional sweets and snacks being flown from the Madurai airport to various destinations.

The makers of the famous jigarthanda recently received a request from a local trader in Singapore for their jigarthanda. After completion of all formalities, including the FSSAI certification, the first consignment of 135 kg was flown to Singapore on a trial basis on Wednesday.

Pandian said that all the ingredients for jigarthanda including the milk, almond gum, sea algae, sugar and the ice cream for the constitution of the drink were being taken from Madurai. “It is the taste of cow’s milk and the handmade ice cream from Madurai that gives the specific taste to the drink, hence all the ingredients have to be taken from here, only the algae is taken in the dry form and will be soaked once it reaches its destination,” he said. As the fasting season of Ramzan is coming up, jigarthanda is expected to be in demand in Singapore as it is an energizer and also has cooling properties. Pandian said that based on the reception that the drink receives in Singapore, the frequency of export may be enhanced to even daily.

Title: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee to call on Naveen Patnaik before zonal council meet tomorrow
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Mamata Banerjee

BHUBANESWAR: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee will call on her Odisha counterpart Naveen Patnaik at his residence here on Friday before the two attend the Eastern Zonal Council meeting to be chaired by Union home minister Amit Shah. Chief ministers of Bihar and Jharkhand, Nitish Kumar and Hemant Soren , are also scheduled to attend the meeting to be held later on the day.

This will be the first time Mamata will meet Shah after the enactment of the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA), one which the Trinamool Congress leader is opposed to, and Naveen supports.

“Mamata will pay Naveen a courtesy visit. There is no fixed agenda in the one-on-one meeting,” sources in the chief minister’s office said even as speculation is rife on what the two leaders would probably discuss.

Sources said the current political situation in the wake of violence in New Delhi over the citizenship act may figure in the brief meeting between the two regional leaders at Naveen Niwas. The same day, Shah is scheduled to address a pro-CAA rally at Janata Maidan in the city.

While Mamata has been a bitter critic of CAA, Naveen has come out in its support. This is not the only aspect on which the two chief ministers differ. While Mamata has vehemently opposed many initiatives of the Narendra Modi government at the Centre, Naveen has been quite the opposite.

In February last year, amid Mamata’s stir against the CBI-West Bengal police row over chit fund probe, Mamata had tried to garner Naveen’s support. But the Odisha chief minister had distanced himself. He was also cold to Mamata’s overtures to enlist his support for a regional front to take on the BJP at the Centre ahead of the 2019 Lok Sabha elections.

The West Bengal chief minister, who landed here on a four-day visit on Tuesday night and headed to Puri, paid obeisance at the 12th century Jagannath temple on Wednesday. Responding to a media query on the violence in New Delhi, Mamata said, “We don’t want blood, we want peace. I prayed for the same before Lord Jagannath.” The first three days of her visit has been termed private.

EoM

Title: Polls to remaining gram panchayats to be held in 3 phases
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

With the high court clearing way for lotteries to reserve seats of panchayat bodies, state election commission is geared up to hold elections in the remaining 4,563 gram panchayats, which is likely to be conducted in three phases.

Title: SRTMU students unhappy with changes in examination schedule
Content:
This story is from February 27, 2020

Representative image

AURANGABAD: Students from Swami Ramanand Teerth Marathwada University (SRTMU) are opposing changes in the examination schedule that make the students appear for two papers on the same day.

Maharashtra higher and technical education minister Uday Samant discussed the changes concerned with SRTMU vice-chancellor Udhav Bhosle in Mumbai on Wednesday.

The changes in contention have been introduced for degree-level last semester examination. A student said it was a regressive step taken by SRTMU to conduct two examinations on the same day.

“The current examination schedule offers inadequate time to prepare for subjects. The university has taken the decision eyeing its own convenience of wrapping up the examination early,” he said.

Sharad Deshmukh, Nanded district president of National Students Union of India (NSUI), said, “Several leading universities have been taking measures to reduce the stress associated with the examinations, SRTMU is perhaps the only varsity which is going in the exact opposite direction. It is practically impossible for students to prepare for two examinations on a single day. The changes in the examination system have been causing huge mental stress to students.”

When contacted, Ashok Kadam, public relations officer of SRTM University , said changes in the examination schedule were introduced by considering the interests of students.

“The protracted schedule of examinations causes unnecessary stress among students and therefore VC decided to shrink the schedule. The shorter period of examination will also result in early declaration of results,” he said.

According to sources, Samant has asked SRTMU to reconsider the changes in the examination schedule. “The minister reportedly told the VC to ensure student-centric functioning. It is unclear whether the decision will be rolled back,” a senior university faculty said.

This story is from February 27, 2020
